job.title: Clinical Operations_Data Scientist
job.plaincontent:
At Roche we believe it’s urgent to deliver medical solutions right now – even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients’ lives and we are brave in both decision and action. And we believe that good business means a better world.
That is why we come to work each day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigour, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow.
As a Data Scientist for our Clinical Operations department, you act as a strategic thought partner to key stakeholders. You are the champion in organizational analytics learning, and ensures expertise continues to flourish and develop towards future business needs. You are responsible for creating strategic and operational plans for the Clinical Operations team and partnering closely with business leaders and end users to understand needs, build or leverage existing capabilities and develop analytical solutions. Accountable for addressing key business questions using primary and secondary data sources in effectively planning and executing trials and supporting broader clinical operations.
You would have the primary responsibility to design and implement analyses using a variety of data sources such as electronic medical records, clinical trials, genomics, etc.
The evidence and insights generated will inform the study management teams and support clinical operations decisions.
This will require an understanding of molecule and disease area strategies, clinical trial data, as well as good knowledge of the clinical trial management systems and data science expertise.
Major Responsibilities
- Dive into data: Develop a comprehensive understanding of the clinical operational data we work with and foster learning with colleagues using analytical tools and applications. - Implement analytics solutions: Work closely with data partners to design and implement efficient analytics tools. - Act as a thought partner and advisor to all relevant teams and stakeholders. Identify evidence needs & recommend and implement data solutions. - Apply analytical and statistical methods to answer a variety of business questions using multiple data sources and technical tools. - Monitor and assess the effectiveness of enrollment and engagement efforts, projects, and practices and identify opportunities to optimize value of investments. - Increase the sophistication and application of advanced analytics methods (including predictive modeling, machine learning, and scalable prototypes) to measure study performance and guide program-level decisions efficiently and at the speed of business. - Regularly assess and adjust priorities based on stakeholder feedback, organizational needs, and strategic relevance. - Demonstrate strategic agility and ability to engage stakeholders to understand and diagnose Clin Ops problems and recommend appropriate courses of action. - Acquire, aggregate and/or curate data and information. - Produce high quality analyses: plan for data processing, design a fit-for-purpose analysis plan, assess effective ways of presenting and delivering the results to maximize impact and interpretability.
Who you are
You have a broad understanding of drug development and commercialization processes, broad therapeutic area knowledge relevant to Roche Pharma’s pipeline and marketed portfolio, internal strategies/tactics, and external trends. As the expert on strategy and execution of relevant focus areas and deliverables, projects and initiatives, you are crucial in ensuring business stakeholders get the right insights and decision support for their business needs.
This new exciting role requires a mix of capabilities: Data Analytics, Information Visualization and Data Science. You are responsible for providing insights with minimal guidance / supervision, leveraging their capabilities in the following areas of expertise:
- Data Analytics: designing and delivering advanced quantitative Data Analyses leveraging large/complex datasets - Information Visualization: acquiring, aggregating and curating data in order to clearly and efficiently communicate and visualize complex quantitative information - Data Science: developing and managing data analytics solutions, providing new capabilities and services for clinical operations to enable decision-making across functions with actionable metrics.
Qualifications
- You hold a MSc, PhD or similar educational background, in a quantitative data science discipline (e.g., statistics, computer science, epidemiology, economics or physical sciences). - With at least 5 years of relevant work experience preferably within pharmaceutical or biotech industry and/or management consulting. - Deep expertise in some of the following areas: Patient Insights, Investigator Insights, Forecasting, Competitive Intelligence, Data Analytics, Advanced Data Analytics, Resourcing, Information Visualization and/or Data Science. - Experience using scripting, statistical & programming languages, visualization and analytical tools a plus (i.e. Python, Tableau, Spotfire, R, SAS, Google/Adobe analytics, SQL). - Hands-on experience implementing advanced analytics and interacting with diverse data sources to translate and enable Clinical Operations decisions. - Experience acting as a strategic thought partner to teams, entrepreneurial mindset, to transform the way we use data and analytics to enable decisions and hasten our delivery of medicines for our patients. - Experience managing outside vendors preferred. - Record of accomplishment of effectively working in a matrix environment with international team members coming from scientific, business and operational backgrounds, using influence without authority. - Experience with agile methodologies (i.e. scrum) is a plus. - Persuasive written and verbal communication skills, easily communicating complex ideas.
Are you ready to apply? We are looking for a person who thinks outside the box - someone who knows that this position can be a rare springboard to many other opportunities at Roche.
Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building teams that represent a range of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.
If you still have questions then please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq.
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
Information Technology, Information Technology > IT Business Process Management, Consulting and Support

  • Hands-on experience implementing advanced analytics and interacting with diverse data sources to translate and enable Clinical Operations decisions.
  • Experience acting as a strategic thought partner to teams, entrepreneurial mindset, to transform the way we use data and analytics to enable decisions and hasten our delivery of medicines for our patients.

  • Experience with agile methodologies (i.e. scrum) is a plus.
  • Persuasive written and verbal communication skills, easily communicating complex ideas.

Information Technology, Information Technology > IT Business Process Management, Consulting and Support

job.title: Lead Statistical Programmer/Data Scientist
job.plaincontent:
At Roche, our vision is to rapidly increase medical advances to provide additional patient benefit. We are passionate about data being a key enabler for our Vision - to Organise, Share and Analyze data for and beyond regulatory approval.
We are seeking outstanding, highly motivated and passionate Statistical Programmers/Data Scientists to join our Statistical Programming Analyst Team at Roche Headquarters in Basel, Switzerland.
You will provide end to end statistical programming and analysis leadership and support in planning, specifying, designing, developing and implementing statistical software solutions for the reporting and analysis of clinical data. This includes driving forward our efforts to improve, automate and simplify the way we work using a variety of programming and visualization software and tools.
In this Position, you will be empowered to:
- Lead global internal and external statistical programming and analysis teams to enable the transformation and analysis of data to support regulatory submissions and insight generation from data. - Connect and collaborate with a wide range of analytical and clinical stakeholders to understand, influence, translate, communicate and implement statistical programming solutions. - Support our capabilities in advanced exploratory analytics and data visualization. - Coach and guide statistical programmers/data scientists. - Lead and contribute to working groups which develop new and improved ways of working. - Invest in your technical and soft skills personal development via trainings, conference attendance and stretch opportunities.
Who you are:
- You have a Growth Mindset - you embrace opportunities to gain skills and perspectives to reach your full potential as a project and technical leader. - You are educated to degree level preferably in Data Science, Statistics/Mathematics, Computer Science, Life Sciences or other analytical fields. - You have worked with clinical data and led teams of programmers providing statistical software solutions to transform and analyse data to support regulatory submissions and insights from data. Knowledge of Industry Standards such as CDISC and regulatory filing experience are expected. - You have excellent programming skills and are curious and passionate about developing your technical skills and knowledge. Software and applications such as SAS, R, RShiny, Spotfire, Python, SQL and Git currently form the core of our business but we are actively looking at new technological and process solutions. - You express excellent communication and collaboration skills and are able to influence stakeholders to adapt to improved ways of working.
We are primarily looking for experienced Statistical Programmers/Data Scientists, however, if you do not fulfill all requirements we will consider applications for more junior positions.
Are you ready to apply? We are looking for someone who thinks beyond the job offered - someone who knows that this position can be a rare springboard to many other opportunities at Roche. When applying for this Position, already project yourself in the future. Think about what could come next and how you would like to build your future.
Who we are:
We are a dynamic and forward thinking Team of 50+ Statistical Programmers/Data Scientists based in a central location in Basel, Switzerland.
Roche employs over 98.000 people across 100 countries with Global Headquarters in Basel. Pushing back the frontiers of healthcare and working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.
Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a range of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.
Do you have questions? Please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq.
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
Research & Development, Research & Development > Clinical Development

Do you have questions? Please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Roche is an equal opportunity employer.

Research & Development, Research & Development > Clinical Development

job.title: Digital Biomarker Mobile Solutions Architect
job.plaincontent:
At Roche, we believe it’s urgent to deliver medical solutions right now – even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients’ lives, and we are fearless in both decision and action. And we believe that good business means a better world.
That is why we come to work every single day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigour, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow.
Who we are
Are you ready to apply your creativity and mobile solutions design skills to transform the way new medicines are developed and to be at the frontier of personalized medicine? Roche’s Digital Biomarkers team is looking for a creative and aspiring mobile solutions designer/architect to help us move forward in the new era of healthcare, where for us this is more than a job. It’s helping to change the world.
Roche Digital Biomarkers is a multi-disciplinary team within Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED) Informatics. Here, a group of talented and passionate colleagues are working on ground-breaking research to shed new light on diseases and ultimately improve development of new drugs for millions of patients.
The Digital Biomarkers Technical Team designs and develops end-to-end technical ecosystems enabling digital science for a range of diseases, including Multiple Sclerosis and Parkinson's Disease. Patient facing applications that run on smartphones and wearables are being created specifically for clinical studies to support novel ways of conducting research.
The Position
As a Mobile Solutions Designer/Architect, you will be working with disease specialists, clinical researchers, software product managers and data analysts to enable innovation in the clinical space that will allow patients to get better treatments in the future. In this role, you will be i) designing and architecting digital biomarker mobile apps collecting high frequency sensor data, ii) translating new product requirements into re-usable mobile solutions features which can be added to the Digital Biomarkers mobile solutions platform, and iii) drive and contribute to end-to-end design and architecture for the Digital Biomarkers mobile solutions platform.
This position requires a passionate and experienced mobile solutions designer/architect with strong technical and interpersonal skills to handle responsibilities including:
-
Designing and prototyping new innovative features for digital biomarker applications
-
Coordinating and contributing to design and architectural work carried out by a group of Scientific Technical Managers and Mobile Developers
-
Identifying and developing innovative ideas for highly engaging patient facing mobile sensor apps
-
Providing mentorship and direction to mobile development project teams
Who You Are
You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You are looking for a company where you receive the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Working in a multicultural environment motivates you. As a fast learner you actively drive the quality of the requirements.Key qualifications:
-
MSc level or above in computer science, business informatics or a related field
-
5+ years designing and developing Android and/or iOS applications
-
3+ years leading software development teams
-
Proven track record of designing innovative mobile solutions
-
Strong conceptual thinker and problem solver
-
Ability to analyze product requirements and translate into practical and re-usable designs for mobile solutions
-
Deep understanding of core Computer Science concepts
-
Strong object-oriented design and programming skills
-
Ability to work well in a multi-disciplinary team and communicate clearly to different stakeholders
-
Quality focused mentality and phenomenal attention to detail
If you are proud of contributing and feel you have the dedication to teamwork and innovation that we are seeking, then Roche is the organization for you. Every role at Roche plays a part in making a difference to patients’ lives. If you want to work in a passionate team, make your mark & improve lives, apply now.
Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
If you have questions, please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq.

job.title: Senior Engineer Elektronik (m/w/d)
job.plaincontent:
Wer wir sind
Roche Diagnostics International AG in Rotkreuz ist ein weltweit führender Anbieter diagnostischer Systeme für Kliniken, Labors und Arztpraxen. In Rotkreuz arbeiten mehr als 2200 Personen, womit dieser Standort zu den wichtigsten von Roche Diagnostics zählt.
Roche ist ein Arbeitgeber, der für Chancengleichheit steht und ungesetzliche Diskriminierung aufgrund von Ethnizität, Hautfarbe, Religion, Geschlecht, sexueller Ausrichtung, Geschlechtsidentität und -Ausdruck, nationaler Herkunft und Abstammung, Alter, mentaler und physischer Behinderung, medizinischem Zustand, Familienstand, Armeezugehörigkeit oder jeglicher anderer Charakteristik, die gesetzlich geschützt ist, strikt verbietet und unterbindet.
Was Sie erwartet
Blutgas- & Elektrolyt (BG/E) Analysesysteme liefern schnelle und wichtige Resultate für Patienten in lebensbedrohlichen Situationen. CPS R&D BG/E entwickelt neue und verbesserte BG/E Analysesysteme und stellt die wissenschaftliche und technische Betreuung bestehender BG/E Systeme sicher.
Wir suchen einen sehr erfahrenen Ingenieur Elektronik um unser Team in der Instrumentierung zu verstärken. In dieser Rolle übernehmen Sie die Planung und Koordination der Arbeitspakete der Elektronik, als auch die eigenständige Entwicklung anspruchsvoller, technischer Arbeitspakete. Sie nützen agile Methoden, um in kurzer Zeit Funktionsmuster zu entwickeln, die in enger Zusammenarbeit mit Experten aller Fachbereiche und den zukünftigen Nutzern laufend weiterentwickelt werden. Dabei gehen sie in iterativen Zyklen auf die neuen Erkenntnisse und Änderungen ein und setzen diese um.
Aufgaben & Verantwortlichkeiten
Sie sind verantwortlich für Tätigkeiten im Bereich Elektronikentwicklung und den späteren Transfer zu Operations. Weiter beinhaltet die Stelle folgende Tätigkeiten:
- Eigenständige Entwicklung und Inbetriebnahme von analogen und digitalen Schaltungen, Baugruppen und Systemen, inklusive Prototypenaufbau, Tests und Dokumentation, als auch übergreifende Planung und Koordination der Elektronik des Neuentwicklungsprojektes - Planung der Elektronik Arbeitspakete des Neuentwicklungsprojektes und Übernahme von Arbeitspaketen, die in einem agilen Setting in kurzen Abständen nachverfolgt werden - Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Experten von andern Fachdisziplinen und Nutzern (z.B. Abstimmung mit Digitaltechnik und SW Entwickler, Kollegen von anderen Gewerken oder Komponenten an anderen Standorten, etc.) - Beauftragung, enge Einbindung und das Management externer Entwicklungspartner für Komponenten oder Teilsysteme - Konkrete und abgrenzbare Arbeitspakete definieren für die Lieferanten und die geordnete Abnahme der Arbeitspakete über alle Entwicklungsphasen hinweg sicherstellen - Zusammenarbeit mit Optik Entwicklung (Interne Fachabteilung für Optik / Spektroskopie) - Abholen von Requirements bei Stakeholdern (z.B. Sensor Entwickler, Reagenzien Team, Product Care, etc.) und erstellen damit ein Lastenheft bzw. führen dieses bei Änderungen kontinuierlich nach. - Arbeitspakete selber übernehmen und die vereinbarten Ergebnisse zum entsprechend Zeitpunkt liefern - In engem Austausch mit den zukünftigen Nutzern und Experten aus verschiedenen Fachrichtungen hinterfragen und verbessern Sie die Anforderungen an die Systemkomponenten und setzen diese im Design um inkl. regelmässigen Tests mit Beteiligung der Nutzer und Experten durch - Mit der R&D-Projektleitung sich in regelmässigen Planungsrunden abstimmen und rapportieren der Fortschritte und Bedürfnisse
Was Sie mitbringen sollten:
- Abschluss in Elektrotechnik (FH, Uni, ETH), oder einem verwandten Studiengang (plus mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Elektronikentwicklung) - Mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von analog Schaltungen im Bereich Messtechnik - Kenntnisse in der robusten Gestaltung von elektronischen Designs für die Messungen von Kleinstströmen (nano- / pikoampere) inkl. Schirmung und Guarding - Schaltungslayouts auf Altium Designer zu erstellen sind Sie sich gewohnt (konkret: Messtechnik für elektrochemische Sensoren / amperometrisch / potentiostatisch / optisch) - Sie kennen sich in der Opto Elektronik Entwicklung aus (konkret: O2 Messtechnik) - Gute Kenntnisse in der Firmware Entwicklung / C Programmierung - Sie sind eine integrative Persönlichkeit, selbständig und kommunikativ - Sie wollen agilen Ansätzen laufende Weiterentwicklungen sicherstellen (Methoden und Planung) - Deutsch und Englisch in Wort und Schrift
Nice to haves:
- Linux Kenntnisse - LT Spice ist Ihnen ein Begriff
Roche ist ein Arbeitgeber, bei dem Chancengleichheit zählt.
Manufacturing, Manufacturing > General Manufacturing

job.title: Principal Quantitative Scientist - Health Economics and Outcome Research
job.plaincontent:
At Roche, 97,000 people across 150 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity, and on seeing each other’s differences as an advantage. To innovate healthcare, Roche has ambitious plans to keep learning and growing – and is seeking people who have the same goals for themselves.
Roche Diagnostics has built a new strategic area – Diagnostics Information Solutions (DIS) – charged with creating a modern portfolio of Clinical Decision Support (CDS) software products that change the way patients are cared for. Our challenge is to bring together complex diagnostic and treatment data from pharmaceuticals, medical devices and IT systems from health care delivery practices, intelligently process, and present this data to clinicians, researchers, and caregivers to improve research outcomes and patient care by offering a suite of CDS solutions.
As a Principal Quantitative Scientist - Health Economics and Outcomes Research , you are part of Data Science & Services (DSS) team at DIS and responsible for leading, planning and managing the execution of health economic and outcomes research (HEOR) projects to generate evidence in support of NAVIFY product portfolio as well as for diagnostic tests from the DIA organization to improve patient care. You will collaborate and interact with key partners within the function and across the organization to gather and shape the HEOR field in diagnostics. You will act as the go-to person in the field of HEOR for DIS.
In this position, you will also ensure that the design, execution, and presentation of evidence are adhering to the scientific standards and that modelling assumptions are clearly documented and communicated. In order to succeed you will use your expertise in HEOR and your experience in handling several different stakeholders. In addition, a good understanding of HEOR perspectives from healthcare providers as hospitals and payers is necessary. Having hand-on experience in building and evaluating HEOR models is essential. Experience of working with real-world data (RWD) in technical tools such as SAS, R, Python, and SQL is a plus.
Responsibilities Include:
- He/she has the primary responsibility for the design, planning and execution of HEOR studies using a variety of healthcare databases including RWD. - Develops HEOR study protocols, leads the analysis and evidence generation, and reviews publications generated from HEOR projects supporting evidence needs for in vitro diagnostics and CDS product portfolio. - He/she will work closely with key partners in DIS and DIA ranging from clinical science, data science, medical affairs to product development and market access, identifying the needs and validating the clinical and economic outcome of new technologies and procedures in hospitals. - Ensures high quality results from analysis which can be published as posters, abstracts or manuscripts for a variety of external and internal events or congresses increasing scientific profile and visibility of the organization. - Supports HEOR projects enabling Health Technology Assessments, Market Access & Reimbursement dossiers for medical devices or CDS systems in collaboration with global teams. - Enables other team members to grow professionally and to gain additional expertise in HEOR. - Maintains knowledge of HEOR science methods and their application, and generates awareness and understanding of the same across DIS and DIA. - Has the ability to explain the strengths and limitations of HEOR and to influence others without authority.
Who are You?
- Expert in HEOR including the understanding of cost structure and procedures at hospitals. - Equipped with hands-on experience applying HEOR approaches to RWD. - Strong collaborator and good team player with good influential skills and able to establish as a thought partner/leader. - Excellent communication skills, effective stakeholder management ability, constructive at giving and receiving feedback. - Strong solution finding, resilience and a sense of ownership with effective prioritization skills, attention to detail and accuracy.
Minimum Skills and Experience
- Solid understanding of and hands-on experience in using various RWD sources for HEOR studies - Good understanding of hospital cost structure and hospital procedures - Proven experience in design, implementation and reporting of HEOR studies in the Diagnostics/Pharma industry - Good leadership skills including project management and the ability to bring new value to teams by motivating and supervising work of others - Excellent communication and collaborations skills - Strategic mindset and can-do attitude
Background/Experience and Education:
- Masters or Doctoral degree in health economics and outcomes research, health service research, epidemiology, public health, economics or similar areas of academic training is required. - At least 5+ years of relevant working experience including designing and conducting HEOR studies and/or medical coding - Experience in generating HEOR studies and evidence to support product or medical device claims is a plus. - Notable HEOR publication history and recent state-of-the-art work. - Recognized as team leader and experience in mentoring team members. - Very good knowledge of English in a business environment.
If you are proud of contributing and feel you have the dedication to teamwork and innovation that we are seeking, then Roche is the organization for you. Every role at Roche plays a part in making a difference to patients’ lives. If you want work in a hardworking team, make your mark & improve lives, apply now.
Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
Research & Development, Research & Development > Modelling & Simulation

  • Strong collaborator and good team player with good influential skills and able to establish as a thought partner/leader.
  • Excellent communication skills, effective stakeholder management ability, constructive at giving and receiving feedback.
  • Strong solution finding, resilience and a sense of ownership with effective prioritization skills, attention to detail and accuracy.


Minimum Skills and Experience

  • Solid understanding of and hands-on experience in using various RWD sources for HEOR studies
  • Good understanding of hospital cost structure and hospital procedures
  • Proven experience in design, implementation and reporting of HEOR studies in the Diagnostics/Pharma industry
  • Good leadership skills including project management and the ability to bring new value to teams by motivating and supervising work of others
  • Excellent communication and collaborations skills
  • Strategic mindset and can-do attitude


Background/Experience and Education:

  • Masters or Doctoral degree in health economics and outcomes research, health service research, epidemiology, public health, economics or similar areas of academic training is required.
  • At least 5+ years of relevant working experience including designing and conducting HEOR studies and/or medical coding
  • Experience in generating HEOR studies and evidence to support product or medical device claims is a plus.
  • Notable HEOR publication history and recent state-of-the-art work.
  • Recognized as team leader and experience in mentoring team members.
  • Very good knowledge of English in a business environment.


If you are proud of contributing and feel you have the dedication to teamwork and innovation that we are seeking, then Roche is the organization for you. Every role at Roche plays a part in making a difference to patients’ lives. If you want work in a hardworking team, make your mark & improve lives, apply now.
 

Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Roche is an equal opportunity employer.

Research & Development, Research & Development > Modelling & Simulation

job.title: Research Associate HTB (temporary)
job.plaincontent:
The Roche Innovation Center Zurich is active in the research and development of engineered therapeutic antibodies, with a focus on the fields of cancer immunotherapy and immunotherapy in general. Part of the Roche Group since 2005, it employs about 180 people.
The candidate will join the Cancer Immunotherapy (CIT) 2 Department at Roche Innovation Center Zürich (Schlieren, Switzerland) and will interact closely with the team of scientists and research associates working on in depth characterization of tumours and development of novel class of cancer immunotherapy agents.
Primary human tumor explants are considered as one of the most relevant pre-clinical tumor models to assess the activity of portfolio assets. Therefore, the candidate will focus on the optimization of ex vivo primary human tumor explant models and assessing of their predictive potential of clinical response.
This is a collaborative project for 2 years sponsored by the Center of Excellence for Human Translational Bioengineering (HTB). The position is temporary for 1 year with the option to extend to 2 years.
The principal responsibilities will include:
- Supporting the work of scientists to compare different systems enabling ex vivo tumor explant cultures in 3D, improvement of conditions to enable longer culture times and increase of viability of tumor, stroma and immune cells - Processing of untreated and treated primary human tumor and blood samples for downstream analysis, including the assessment of tumor cell lysis, immune cell activation and proliferation using the following technologies: FACS sorting, multiparametic flow cytometry (> 12 colors) or CyTOF, single cell RNA-sequencing (scRNA-seq), LDH release, IHC and Imaging, CBA - Data analysis and interpretation, preparation of scientific presentations - Writing of scientific reports, patents and research articles - Laboratory manager responsibilities including daily lab routine, ordering supplies, monitoring inventory will also be required
Who you are:
You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies, and where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point.
We are looking for a highly motivated Research Associate to join our CIT group. You are someone with excellent organizational skills, fully committed to team work and highly flexible.
For this position you bring the following qualifications:
- Bachelor, Master’s degree or Lab technician with recent research experience in tumor immunology, cell biology or cancer immunotherapy (no PhD) - Excellent hands-on experience with tumor cell-immune cell cultures and co-cultures, PBMC isolation, hands-on experience with ex vivo human primary 2D and 3D tumor tissue culture models or organoids is a plus - Excellent hands-on experience in state-of-the art immunoprofiling techniques for functional characterization of immune responses (FACS-based cell sorting, multiparametric FACS analysis of tumor and immune cells is a must; experience with single RNA sequencing, CyTOF, IF, imaging, spatial-omics and high dimensional data analysis is a plus) - Good written and verbal English is mandatory - Strong communication and presentation skills - Ability to work effectively and independently within a diverse group of people - Excellent organizational skills, ability to take initiative and work according to time-lines - Maintenance of the laboratory/workstation in accordance with current technical, safety and regulatory standards
Roche is an equal opportunity employer and strictly prohibits unlawful discrimination based upon an individual’s race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, mental/physical disability, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
*For non-EU / EFTA citizens: Please state your eligibility status to work in Switzerland (e.g. B-Permit, C-Permit) and note that if you do not own a valid Swiss work permit, Roche cannot guarantee your final employment due to authority regulations. ** PhD's and Postdocs's cannot be considered for associate roles in Roche pRED.
Roche ist ein Arbeitgeber, bei dem Chancengleichheit zählt.

job.title: Senior Director RMD Assay Development
job.plaincontent:
Who We Are
Roche Diagnostics International Ltd in Rotkreuz is one of the world’s leading providers of diagnostic system solutions for clinics, laboratories and doctors’ offices. The company employs over 2200 people in Rotkreuz and is one of Roche Diagnostics main sites.
Roche is an equal opportunity employer and strictly prohibits unlawful discrimination based upon an individual’s race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, mental/physical disability, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
The Department
Roche Molecular Solutions develops and produces innovative tests based on the Nobel Prize-winning discovery of the polymerase chain reaction (PCR). The tests developed by this business area for oncology, virology, HPV, microbiology and for screening blood products are used around the world by researchers, doctors, patients, hospitals, laboratories and blood banks.
As Senior Director, you will be responsible for the RMD Assay Development Department in Rotkreuz, Switzerland (50+ employees).
What you will do
- Member of the Development Management Team - Create an environment of strong team spirit, timely and effective communications, sense of urgency, high motivation and inspire teams across Assay Development to achieve goals in the immediate and longer term - Establish strategic goals and objectives and maintain full strategic responsibility for the Assay Development organization in coordination with Assay Development in California - Responsible for Assay Development Cost Centre with a cost budget of about CHF 30m 40m per year - Providing a “sanity check” for Assay Development resource allocations to Life Cycle Teams to ensure adequate staffing of projects - Work directly with other functions and Lifecycle Leaders to allocate resources according to strategic priorities - Hiring and training of new staff, preserving/ensuring state-of-the-art technical know-how - Develop Senior Staff members for career progression and skill building; manage corrective actions - Assist Line managers in developing key talent within the organization and ensure continuous skill building - Ensure compliance of staff with the Quality Management System and employment laws - Management of facilities/infrastructure needed for development - Enable/encourage/foster/facilitate so that department members can:
- - work effectively (e.g. appropriate training and development) - - work well as part of teams - - flexibly deal with the unexpected
- Manage working relationships or project related interactions with Process and Support, System Development, external suppliers, and other internal departments - Mediate personnel issues/disputes - Manage the execution/delivery of a project within development
Who you are
You are someone who wants to influence your own development. You are looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point.
- PhD in Biological/Life Sciences, Chemistry, Biochemistry or related field, or equivalent combination of education and work-related experience. - Excellent leadership skills and demonstrated ability to lead groups of scientists working on complex projects. - Proven collaboration/influence management, decision-making, and leadership skills, and a demonstrated drive for results. - Demonstrated interpersonal skills to work effectively with and manage cross-functional, cross-enterprise, cross-cultural teams in multiple locations. - Knowledge and experience with complex data tools and ability to implement digital strategies to use data to improve product performance and identify product problems is a significant advantage for any candidate. - Demonstrates Roche Values and Core Competencies - Excellent written and oral communication skills in English (German is a plus). - Ability to travel locally, domestically, and internationally approximately 10% of the time.
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
Research & Development, Research & Development > Devices, Systems and Solutions

job.title: PhD in Oncology Discovery Pharmacology Group (3 years)
job.plaincontent:
At Roche, 80,000 people across 150 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. We believe in the urgency of delivering medical solutions right now – even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients’ lives and we are fearless in both decision-making and taking action. We believe that good business means a better world. That is why we come to work every single day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigor, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow.
The position
Oncology Discovery Pharmacology translates scientific discoveries into effective medicines for cancer patients. The Oncology Discovery Pharmacology Group is an integral unit within pRED Oncology that leads the preclinical assessment of novel drugs candidate, by using state-of-the-art animal facility, innovative preclinical mouse tumor models, along with innovative multiplex technologies and cutting edge preclinical imaging approaches.
Within this environment, we are looking for a talented and motivated graduate student who will bring his/her scientific creativity and natural curiosity to tackle important unmet medical needs.
As PhD student in the Oncology Discovery Pharmacology Group you will focus on exploratory research project titled: “Tumor-Immune co-evolution and therapeutic response in next generation Colorectal Cancer (CRC) mouse models”.
In this PhD project, you will:
• Characterize the immune landscape at different stages of tumor progression on primary and metastatic sites
• Determine the therapeutic efficacy of cancer immunotherapies at different progression stage (early stage vs late stage and primary tumor vs metastases)
• Identify potential signatures responsible for Response vs Resistance to cancer immunotherapies
Who You Are
You are someone who wants to influence your own development. You are looking for a company, which gives you the opportunity to pursue your interests and develop your research skills across different functions. Working in a multicultural environment motivates you. Moreover, you have very good interpersonal and communication skills, you are able to build good working relationships, and are an outstanding team player.
You are/have:
• A Master degree in the field of tumor biology, and/or Immunology.
• Hands-on experience in rodent models of cancer with knowledge and experience in animal handling, anesthetic and surgical procedures
• Have a LTK 1 certificate or equivalent
• Hands-on experience in cell culture techniques and a strong interest in cellular and molecular biology
• The experience and investigative attitude that allows you to work independently, to design, perform, and interpret experiments, and to embark on new scientific methodologies
• Strong presentation skills to communicate scientific data through internal seminars and team meetings, external conferences and research journals
• Fluent in spoken and written English
Application needs to include a CV, two references and a motivation letter.
The graduate student will be enrolled in an academic doctoral external program at an accredited university, selected based on research excellence and international reputation. During the doctoral research period, a pair of co-supervisors, one based at Roche and the other based at the selected University will mentor the student.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
If you still have questions then please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq.
Tags: ROiQQ ROiLS
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.

job.title: Regional Real Estate, Facilities & Utility Specialists Europe
job.plaincontent:
We believe it’s urgent to deliver medical solutions right now – even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients’ lives. We are courageous in both decision and action. And we believe that good business means a better world.
That is why we come to work every single day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigor, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow.
We are proud of who we are, what we do, and how we do it. We are many, working as one across functions, across companies, and across the world.
Roche Global Procurement is hiring a Regional Real Estate, Facilities & Utilities Specialist Europe to lead and manage our region Europe, group wide RE, FM & Utility Procurement activities, ensuring successful execution of procurement goals and objectives. Creates an environment of trust, partnership and empowerment, while seeking continuous improvement. Focusing on quality, customer satisfaction, total cost of ownership and best practice processes and principles by acknowledging international standards and best practice. This role will drive the development of advanced and innovative sourcing strategies through a rigorous supplier management and service delivery process. Manages procurement performance and customer satisfaction based on clearly defined financial and non-financial measurements. Develops and maintains procurement specific metrics to be achieved within a defined period.
Global Procurement (GP) is a key function that delivers value beyond savings to Roche by using market knowledge, subject matter expertise and business insights in the procurement of goods and services and the management of Roche’s third party spend. Through collaboration with our external suppliers and internal business partners, GP helps bring innovative tests and medicines to patients.
We are looking for a highly motivated and dedicated person, executing a pipeline of high-value strategic initiatives in Europe (Americas). Based on your deep subject matter expertise in the area of Real Estate, Facilities & Utilities, you are dedicatedly finding opportunities, engaging, and collaborating with cross-divisional senior business partners, stakeholder and regional procurement.
You will develop, align and introduce e.g. activity, condition based service delivery and you are familiar with modern asset management concepts as part of the service delivery requirements
In your role as Regional RE, FM & Utility Specialist, you will act in addition as KAM & Relationship Manager for a specific Roche business division. You will be responsible to foster communication and collaboration, mutual target setting & achievement process, expectation management and maintaining an open line into the wider business. You will connect internal demand with external market capabilities. With this foundation, you will provide and assure an environment of trust, partnership and mutual success.
Thanks to your strong leadership, communication, and influencing skills, you ensure partner alignment and support to deliver outstanding value through the implementation of Strategies and initiatives.
Your main responsibilities include:
-
Creation and application of a Business-aligned long-term Category Strategy and the development of an annual pipeline of strategic initiatives.
-
Provide regional and globally aligned input to the development of the Real Estate, Facilities & Utilities Category Buying Guide to translate the Category Strategy into operational excellence.
-
Understanding business priorities and challenges and ensuring successful comprehension of the Category Strategy by building positive relationships across geographically dispersed partners and engaging with local and regional Procurement and business partners.
-
Ensuring a robust approach to supplier management, establishing value creation targets, reporting and regular business reviews.
-
Foster KAM & Relationship Management within the assigned region and division throughout all hierarchical levels.
Who you are?
You are someone who wants to influence your own development. You are looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies, and where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point.
You have university level education (MSc or equivalent or higher) in Real Estate, Facility Management or related field with good technical understanding. You have 3-5 years of in-depth strategic and/or operational procurement experience with deep understanding of category management and advanced strategic sourcing, with subject matter expertise in Real Estate, Facilities & Utility categories, as well as proven experience in managing a portfolio of international projects.
We are looking for the following qualifications:
-
Excellent communication and project management skills with an ability to lead and handle cross-functional teams and deliver complex strategic initiatives, in a truly global/regional, fluid, interactive environment. Strong and clear communication across all hierarchical levels and entities of the regional organization
-
Excellent leadership in a matrix organization even without direct reporting lines. Ability to build lasting relationships and trust throughout divisional and hierarchical structure
-
Professional and dedicated KAM and Relationship Management with exceptional openness and understanding for other cultures, expectations and objectives. Passionate about Real Estate & Facilities Management
-
Confirmed capability in negotiation, change management and stakeholder management
-
Clear and transparent decision making with a high sense of and desire for continuous improvement. Strong systematic thinking with ability to self-reflect.
-
Business level fluency in English, German is an asset
This is a regional role and the location is flexible if justified. If you are passionate about this role and are not currently based at one of the preferred locations listed, please contact the recruiter for more information.
If this resonates with you and you want to shape your future in the biggest production site in our network: We are looking forward to receiving your application!
If you still have questions then please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq
Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.
Roche ist ein Arbeitgeber, bei dem Chancengleichheit zählt.

Strong and clear communication across all hierarchical levels and entities of the regional organization

  • Excellent leadership in a matrix organization even without direct reporting lines. Ability to build lasting relationships and trust throughout divisional and hierarchical structure

  • Professional and dedicated KAM and Relationship Management with exceptional openness and understanding for other cultures, expectations and objectives. Passionate about Real Estate & Facilities Management

  • Confirmed capability in negotiation, change management and stakeholder management

  • Clear and transparent decision making with a high sense of and desire for continuous improvement. Strong systematic thinking with ability to self-reflect.

  • Business level fluency in English, German is an asset

This is a regional role and the location is flexible if justified. If you are passionate about this role and are not currently based at one of the preferred locations listed, please contact the recruiter for more information.

If this resonates with you and you want to shape your future in the biggest production site in our network: We are looking forward to receiving your application!

If you still have questions then please check our FAQs and videos oncareers.roche.ch/faq

Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

job.title: Global IT Training Manager
job.plaincontent:
At Roche, 94,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity. We do this today to build a better tomorrow. We are many, working as one across functions, across companies, and across the world.The ASPIRE Program is a multi-year program which aims at defining and developing the functional ERP roadmaps in order to simplify, standardize and automate business processes and systems leveraging SAP’s, industry and available Roche best practices.
Reporting to the Global Head of ERP Transformation, the Global IT Training Manager is responsible for defining, developing and maintaining the IT Training strategy that will support the Communications and the Organizational Change Management plans, lead the development of the IT training framework, toolbox, tracking and support the roll out of the different training plans globally and regionally. The Global IT Training Manager will work closely with a wide area of stakeholders within and outside the Program, ASPIRE Management Team members, workstream leads and members, in particular ASPIRE Program Training leads, OCM leads and Communication Managers, all three business regions and its affiliates, global business and IT teams, as well as Roche ERP team members.
Your primary responsibilities include:
- Assess, evaluate, analyze and define IT learning needs and requirements for the IT ASPIRE Program and project team members, for the ASPIRE program and project team members with regards to IT trainings (including, but not limited to systems, solutions and processes), for Roche ERP team members and the Roche IT organization affected by the ASPIRE program - Define and develop the IT Training strategy and plans. Deliver the learning solutions together with the ASPIRE Organizational Change Management team, Communication Managers and other ASPIRE stakeholders and aligned with the overall Program plan phases (Initiate, Define, Design, Build, Test, Deploy and Nurture, etc…) for the ASPIRE Core team and other Roche organization impacted by the ASPIRE program - Design, develop and implement the IT learning framework for the ASPIRE teams and stakeholders, including embedding new ways of working for the ASPIRE program and IT organizations, adoption and application of methodology, technology and solutions to support the ASPIRE program delivery (Roche PMM enhanced with SAP Activate, Focused Build Solution Delivery and Application Lifecycle Management supported by SAP SolMan) - Develop, implement and track the IT training plans through robust KPIs and status reporting. Support the IT ASPIRE Leadership team, providing guidance and leadership regarding training and learning topics. Engage with IT Line managers to drive the training behavior and change management strategies - Demonstrate leadership, facilitation and problem solving skills in order to plan, design, deliver and maintain successful learning programs - Build and develop strong sustainable relationships with all internal and external stakeholders, working collaboratively with them to achieve common goals and share knowledge and best practice - Manage stakeholders on all levels and across the organization to ensure an aligned approach on the adoption of the solutions
You bring the following qualifications:
- Educated to Master’s, MBA degree level or equivalent in business or IT - 10 to 15+ years of experience in IT projects, Learning and Development for large scale projects and programs - 10+ years of experience in broad project-based experience delivering Learning strategies - 10+ years of experience in delivering learning face to face and virtually - 10+ years of experience in working with external learning vendors to deliver learning solutions - Previous experience working in a regulated environment (GxP, ISO...) is preferred - Relevant work experience in learning and development, training, human resources or other related project management; ideally some of which has been gained in the pharmaceutical industry - Good communication, collaboration and presentation skills(at all levels of an organization) - Proven leadership, collaboration and professionalism with internal and external stakeholders and management of all levels; ability to work effectively and efficiently in cross-functional, often virtual and matrixed team - Excellent skills in crafting presentations and verbal and written communications - Previous experience leading or coordinating cross functional teams - Strong influencing, motivation and negotiation skills: proven abilities to influence others without authority - People and third party management - English: Business fluency (native English speaker highly desired)
Please note this position will be onsite in Kaiseraugst
Are you ready to apply? We are looking for someone who thinks beyond the job offered - someone who knows that this position can be a rare springboard to many other opportunities at Roche. When applying for this position, already project yourself in the future. Think about what could come next and how you wish to build your future.
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
Human Resources, Human Resources > Leadership & Organizational Development
job.htmlcontent:
At Roche, 94,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity. We do this today to build a better tomorrow. We are many, working as one across functions, across companies, and across the world.The ASPIRE Program is a multi-year program which aims at defining and developing the functional ERP roadmaps in order to simplify, standardize and automate business processes and systems leveraging SAP’s, industry and available Roche best practices.

Reporting to the Global Head of ERP Transformation, the Global IT Training Manager is responsible for defining, developing and maintaining the IT Training strategy that will support the Communications and the Organizational Change Management plans, lead the development of the IT training framework, toolbox, tracking and support the roll out of the different training plans globally and regionally. The Global IT Training Manager will work closely with a wide area of stakeholders within and outside the Program, ASPIRE Management Team members, workstream leads and members,  in particular ASPIRE Program Training leads, OCM leads and Communication Managers, all three business regions and its affiliates, global business and IT teams, as well as Roche ERP team members.

Your primary responsibilities include:

  • Assess, evaluate, analyze and define IT learning needs and requirements for the IT ASPIRE Program and project team members, for the ASPIRE program and project team members with regards to IT trainings (including, but not limited to systems, solutions and processes), for Roche ERP team members and the Roche IT organization affected by the ASPIRE program
  • Define and develop the IT Training strategy and plans. Deliver the learning solutions together with the ASPIRE Organizational Change Management team, Communication Managers and other ASPIRE stakeholders and aligned with the overall Program plan phases (Initiate, Define, Design, Build, Test, Deploy and Nurture, etc…) for the ASPIRE Core team and other Roche organization impacted by the ASPIRE program
  • Design, develop and implement the IT learning framework for the ASPIRE teams and stakeholders, including embedding new ways of working for the ASPIRE program and IT organizations, adoption and application of methodology, technology and solutions to support the ASPIRE program delivery (Roche PMM enhanced with SAP Activate, Focused Build Solution Delivery and Application Lifecycle Management supported by SAP SolMan)
  • Develop, implement and track the IT training plans through robust KPIs and status reporting. Support the IT ASPIRE Leadership team, providing guidance and leadership regarding training and learning topics. Engage with IT Line managers to drive the training behavior and change management strategies
  • Demonstrate leadership, facilitation and problem solving skills in order to plan, design, deliver and maintain successful learning programs
  •  Build and develop strong sustainable relationships with all internal and external stakeholders, working collaboratively with them to achieve common goals and share knowledge and best practice
  • Manage stakeholders on all levels and across the organization to ensure an aligned approach on the adoption of the solutions

You bring the following qualifications:

  • Educated to Master’s, MBA degree level or equivalent in business or IT
  • 10 to 15+ years of experience in IT projects, Learning and Development for large scale projects and programs
  • 10+ years of experience in broad project-based experience delivering Learning strategies
  • 10+ years of experience in delivering learning face to face and virtually
  • 10+ years of experience in working with external learning vendors to deliver learning solutions
  • Previous experience working in a regulated environment (GxP, ISO...) is preferred
  • Relevant work experience in learning and development, training, human resources or other related project management; ideally some of which has been gained in the pharmaceutical industry
  • Good communication, collaboration and presentation skills(at all levels of an organization)
  • Proven leadership, collaboration and professionalism with internal and external stakeholders and management of all levels; ability to work effectively and efficiently in cross-functional, often virtual and matrixed team
  • Excellent skills in crafting presentations and verbal and written communications
  • Previous experience leading or coordinating cross functional teams
  • Strong influencing, motivation and negotiation skills: proven abilities to influence others without authority
  • People and third party management
  • English: Business fluency (native English speaker highly desired)

Please note this position will be onsite in Kaiseraugst

Roche is an equal opportunity employer.

job.title: Global Senior IT PMO Lead
job.plaincontent:
At Roche, we believe it’s urgent to deliver medical solutions right now – even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients’ lives and we are confident in both decision and action. And we believe that good business means a better world. ASPIRE is a multi-year program that will define, design, and deploy Future ERP solutions based on SAP S/4 HANA and other cloud/on-premise technology platforms. The program will enable simplified, standardized, and harmonized global business processes by leveraging SAP, Life Science Industry and Roche best practices.
As the Global Senior IT PMO Lead, you will be responsible to direct and manage the IT Program Management Office (PMO) to ensure the program and all included projects meet their goals and requirements, including program and project management, control, risk, decision and issue management. You will guide and monitor the IT teams in their execution of program and project management activities, and provide the governance oversight, setup and manage project and program governance structures. In your role as a member of the IT ASPIRE team, you will collaborate with colleagues from across Roche to identify, discuss, and resolve program/project challenges. You will demonstrate your excellent skills to assist in successfully integrating and becoming a key member of the ERP Program Operations team that is accountable for leading various projects and initiatives. You will work closely with the PMOs in the different functions to ensure consistency across the entire program.
This role reports to the Global Head of ERP Program Operations.
Your primary responsibilities include:
-
Responsible for the operational management of the IT Program Management Office (i.e. functional, technical and organizational aspects) and conducts reviews of Risk, Issue, Assumptions, Decisions Management and Scope Management, Program Planning and Schedule Management, Status reporting incl. KPI Management, Quality assurance and control, Project Templates and Documentation Management, Methodology Management, Vendor Management
-
Direct and manage the IT Program Management Office (PMO) to ensure the program and all included projects meet their goals and requirements
-
Direct and manage internal and external resources to deliver on the program objectives
-
Drive, lead and ensure delivery of broader, highly complex projects for the program, across multiple areas, technologies and geographies, working closely with identified business and IT key stakeholders to ensure continuous business and IT alignment while minimizing impacts on the organization. Ensure all projects aspects (budget, resources, timelines, risks, issues, dependencies) are addressed using ASPIRE program and Roche PMM methodologies
-
Establish and drive application of principles and concepts to independently address strategic business and technology initiatives and projects that are novel in their innovation and ensure organizational change is in place to adopt new approaches to strategy and delivery
-
Conduct dependency checks and manage dependencies, risks and issues between projects. Measure and report progress and status on all IT ASPIRE aspects. Act as an escalation point of contact and drive resolution of escalated issues
-
Develop and maintain the program integrated management plan
-
Develop and perform integrated change control (across projects and ERP pillars) and conduct impact assessment of scope changes
-
Guide and monitor project teams in their execution of project management best practices, and provide governance project oversight
-
Set up and manage project and program governance structures and chairs the IT PMO meetings, the cross-functional governance board
-
Support IT ASPIRE Leadership Team on tactical, operational and strategic program management topics
You bring the following qualifications:
-
Educated to Master’s, MBA degree level or equivalent in business or IT
-
Proven track record of managing successfully large scale global IT transformational projects and programs
-
15+ years of program and/or project management experience in a global enterprise delivering SAP ERP solutions or other large IT platforms, preferably in the Life Science industry, business innovation or laboratory information systems (ERP, MES, QMS, Clinical Systems, Finance, Sales, Distribution, Supply Chain Planning…)
-
12+ years of hands on experience in project management, focusing on implementation projects, typically in the area of Lifesciences and IT, 10+ years of functional SAP configuration or development experience on large project implementations, preferably in the Life Science industry
-
Ability to drive effectively global, diverse and cross functional teams and at all organizational levels in a multi-cultural environment
-
Demonstrated ability to influence and foster collaborative relationships with ability to engage resources outside of direct-control to gain consensus, meet deadlines and achieve goals and objectives
-
Experience in consultancy, strategy design and change are a strong advantage
-
Experience in presenting and negotiating effectively whilst building strong partnerships
-
Outstanding communication skills are essential with the ability to communicate credibly at all levels; influence key stakeholders in a highly complex cross-functional environment and build collaborative relationships to ensure seamless program and project delivery
-
Excellent leadership, management and interpersonal skills in large enterprise as well as experience in delivering projects using Roche project management methodology (PMM) or equivalent
-
Hands-on experience in delivering complex projects using Agile methodologies
-
Prior experience with SAP Solution Manager is desirable
-
PMI PMP certification or equivalent desirable
-
Fluent in English
If you are proud of contributing and feel you have the dedication to teamwork and innovation that we are seeking, then Roche is the organization for you. Every role at Roche plays a part in making a difference to patients’ lives. If you want to work in a passionate team, make your mark & improve lives, apply now.
Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
Information Technology, Information Technology > IT Portfolio and Project Management

job.title: Predictive Maintenance Expert
job.plaincontent:
Roche Diagnostics’ mission as an industry leader is to provide innovative digital solutions to support its customers and setting them up for success in a highly demanding and dynamic environment. Solution Integration & Services (SIS) is a critical contributor and enabler of Roche’s divisional aspiration to realize the connected core lab, and to provide integrated diagnostics information anywhere, anytime. The international business team (IBT) Service Analytics is part of the Analytics & Services lifecycle team – sharing the aspiration to transform the focus of the lab by exploiting data to proactively make it simpler to operate and give it the power to deliver more value to the healthcare system.
Laboratory business continuity – or in other words: optimizing up-time and minimizing unexpected downtime of Roche instruments. In the IBT Service Analytics we are delivering smart solutions that enable the Roche service organization globally to evolve from reactive to predictive maintenance – by leveraging data analytics methodologies like machine learning and artificial intelligence.
We are looking to hire an International Product Manager with experience in requirements engineering in particular in the context of predictive maintenance. In this role, you will shape the Service Analytics product portfolio and enable the service organizations and instrument teams on their journey to predictive maintenance.
Your main tasks will include:
- You enable “design for predictive maintenance” for our instruments
- by creating clear, actionable requirements (i.e. from customer requirements down to technical specifications) in close cooperation with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. instrument lifecycle team, manufacturer, global service team, development team, etc.) - by supporting the global service team in defining the instrument service concept in regards to predictive maintenance - by defining data and data upload concepts for an instrument to enable predictive maintenance
- You will act as a “translator” fostering communication e.g. between subject matter experts, data scientists and engineers, to make sure that reliable predictive models for dedicated instruments are available and implemented - You identify, initiate and successfully implement measures to ensure a high performance end-to-end business process from data creation to actionable insights – working jointly with subject matter experts and the global Remote Service team
To be successful in this role, you should bring:
- Demonstrated ability to foster agreement and alignment with complex set of stakeholders - A proven experience within implementing predictive maintenance in a high-tech sector - preferably in the IVD industry - A structured personality, with the ability to capture and manage complex tasks, an open mindset, challenging conventional paradigms & willingness to learn - Passionate about using data driven methods for solving complex problems - Strong ability to identify main stakeholders and do proper stakeholder management across the value chain (from markets to R&D) - Willingness to travel 30 to 50% of your time - Exceptional communication skills in English - Ideally you also have experience with agile methodologies and software development
If you are keen on creating a new vision that will impact our customer and patients’ lives, then send us your application today!
Roche ist ein Arbeitgeber, bei dem Chancengleichheit zählt.
Sales & Marketing, Sales & Marketing > Marketing

Laboratory business continuity – or in other words: optimizing up-time and minimizing unexpected downtime of Roche instruments. job.title: Rezept- und Methoden-Spezialist/in in der ADC und SUT-MAB-Produktion (m/w)
job.plaincontent:
Im Bereich Basel Biotech Manufacturing stellen wir mit modernsten Anlagen verschiedene therapeutische Wirkstoffe her. In der neuen „hybrid Single Use Produktionsanlage (SUT)“ in Basel stellen wir monoklonale Antikörper (MAB) her. Hierbei werden Nährmedien und Puffer hergestellt, als auch die Fermentation und die anschliessende Aufreinigung durchgeführt.
In der ADC (Antibody Drug Conjugate) Anlage wird in einer konventionellen Stahl Anlage ein Antikörper Toxin Konjugat hergestellt.
Als Rezept- und Methoden-Spezialist in der ADC und SUT-MAB Produktion sind Sie schwerpunktmässig für folgende Aufgaben verantwortlich:
-
Verantwortlich für die Erstellung und Optimierung von Rezepten und MES-Auftragsvorlagen und/oder für Warenverwaltung und Rohstoffmanagement
-
Mitverantwortlich für das Erstellen von Changes an PLS und MES
-
Mitarbeit bei Abklärungen von Prozess-Abweichungen im Aufgabenbereich
-
Mitarbeit beim Optimieren der Prozessabläufe, Rezepte und PLS/MES
-
Erstellung und Bearbeitung von SOP`s im Aufgabenbereich
-
Unterstützung als SME bei internen und externen Audits und Inspektionen
-
Vertretung des Produktionsbereiches „Production Services“ in lokalen und globalen Governance Gremien / Task Forces.
-
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Abteilungen Qualitätssicherung, MSAT (Manufacturing Sciences & Technology), Engineering, sowie mit den internen Arbeitsgruppen „Produktionsingenieure“, dem „Tagesteam Technik“ und den jeweiligen Schichten.
Für die Tätigkeit als Rezept- und Methoden-Spezialist in der ADC und SUT-MAB Produktion bringen Sie die folgenden Voraussetzungen mit:
-
Abgeschlossenes Studium mit wissenschaftlicher oder technischer Fachrichtung, vorzugsweise in Biotechnologie, Bioverfahrenstechnik, Pharmatechnik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation (z.B. abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung als Chemie- und Pharmatechnologe mit langjähriger Berufserfahrung).
-
2-5 Jahre Erfahrung in der biotechnologischen Entwicklung, Produktion oder Qualitätssicherung von Vorteil
-
Erfahrung mit hochautomatisierten Anlagen (PLS und MES)
-
Erfahrung mit Rezepterstellung mit Siemens PC-S7 und Unicorn Methodenrezeptierung von Vorteil
-
Zeitgerechte, effektive Kommunikation sowie Sinn für Dringlichkeit.
-
Sehr gutes GMP Verständnis, sowie Qualitäts- und Sicherheitsbewusstsein.
-
Flexibilität, Teamfähigkeit, Entscheidungsfreudigkeit und selbstständige Arbeitsweise in einem komplexen Umfeld.
-
Fliessende Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch (Wort und Schrift); Englischkenntnisse von Vorteil
Haben Sie Fragen? Erkundigen Sie sich bitte auf careers.roche.ch/faq.
Roche ist ein Arbeitgeber, bei dem Chancengleichheit zählt.
Manufacturing, Manufacturing > General Manufacturing

  • Flexibilität, Teamfähigkeit, Entscheidungsfreudigkeit und selbstständige Arbeitsweise in einem komplexen Umfeld.

  • Fliessende Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch (Wort und Schrift); Englischkenntnisse von Vorteil

Haben Sie Fragen? Erkundigen Sie sich bitte aufcareers.roche.ch/faq.

job.title: Roche Postdoctoral Fellowship (RPF) in immunoepigenomics of tumor microenvironments
job.plaincontent:
At Roche, we believe it’s urgent to deliver medical solutions right now – even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients’ lives and we are fearless in both decision and action. And we believe that good business means a better world.
That is why we come to work every single day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigour, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow.
Roche’s Innovation Center in Zürich develops novel cancer immunotherapies, and data scientists in our research organization pursue various computational analyses to support early stage drug projects and identify novel therapeutic opportunities.
The position
The Roche Postdoctoral Fellowship (RPF) Programme has the ambition to build and maintain the Scientific Leadership of the future and to provide leading Roche scientists with the opportunity to collaborate with talented postdoctoral researchers, and leading academic research groups, from around the world. One of the key aims is to advance basic science and technologies that will be published in top-rated, peer-reviewed scientific journals, if necessary preceded by priority patent applications.
As a Postdoctoral Fellow in the Department of Pharmaceutical Research & Early Development Informatics, you will focus on characterizing genome-wide DNA accessibility of various cell types within solid tumor microenvironments, comprising cancer cells and infiltrating immune cells. You will be responsible for leading an independent project that aligns with the goals of the cancer immunotherapy research and development organization as well as the advanced analytics network of our data scientists.
The duration of the RPF project is initially set for two years, with the possibility of extension for a third year. You will be based in Roche Innovation Center Zürich with stays at our academic partner in Helmholz Zentrum München. The partnership with Academia will provide further insights on advanced analysis of single-cell ATAC-seq data and epigenomics.
In this position you will:
-
make use of published single-cell ATAC-seq libraries to develop advanced analytics methods for identifying cell types based on their accessibility profiles
-
pursue complementary analyses of public and/or in-house ATAC-seq and RNA-seq data sets to detect novel biomarkers and targets for the benefit of cancer immunotherapy drug projects
-
apply the newly generated methodology to relevant datasets for our clinical and pre-clinical studies
Who you are:
You are a motivated applicant with a postgraduate scientific degree in the field of computational epigenomics, medical genomics, or related field, and interested in developing your advanced analytics skills. Candidates who have worked on biomedical machine learning are particularly encouraged to apply.
Furthermore, you have experience and expertise in the following:
-
We expect you to integrate with a dynamic environment of specialists in biomarker development, computational epigenetics, research informatics and machine learning.
-
You should have some experience in computational genomics/epigenetics (e.g. analysis of expression profiling, single cell transcriptomics, ATAC-seq) and bioinformatics.
-
Preferably, you should also have some prior exposure to immunology, oncology and machine learning methodologies.
-
A demonstrated use of at least one of the following programming languages is critical for this position: R, Python. Interest and experience in data management and engineering solutions is desirable.
-
You have very good interpersonal and communication skills, are able to build good working relationships, and are an outstanding teammate.
-
Your experience and investigative attitude allow you to work independently, to design, perform, and interpret experiments, and to embark on new scientific methodologies.
-
You have been actively engaged in scientific research continuously since your PhD and are ready to start an RPF postdoctoral activity no later than 5 years after your PhD.
If you are proud of contributing and feel you have the dedication to teamwork and innovation that we are seeking, then Roche is the organization for you. Every role at Roche plays a part in making a difference to patients’ lives. If you want to work in a hardworking team, make your mark & improve lives, apply now!
When does it start?
The start date of this fellowship is the 1st of September 2020, or on availability. Please clearly indicate your preferred starting date on your motivation letter.
Applications should include a CV, a motivation letter, a publication list, and, if available, your PhD certificate.
Do you know what Roche stands for?
Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.
If you still have questions, then please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq
More information about the RPF Programme:https://www.roche.com/careers/workplaces/wp_research/the-roche-postdoctoral-fellowship-programme.htm
Roche ist ein Arbeitgeber, bei dem Chancengleichheit zählt.
