job.title: Laborant-/in Inprozesskontrolle (m/w) ADC-Produktion
job.plaincontent:
Im Bereich Basel Biotech Manufacturing stellen wir mit modernsten Anlagen Wirkstoffe zur Therapie von Krebs her. Zur Produktion von Antikörper / Wirkstoff-Konjugaten (ADC) wird am Standort Basel eine bestehende Produktionsanlage wieder in Betrieb genommen.
Die Herstellung und Durchführung dieser Prozesse finden mit Hilfe hochautomatisierten Anlagen unter Einhaltung von cGMP.
Für diese ADC-Produktion suchen wir einen Laborant-/in Inprozesskontrolle, welcher an den folgenden Aufgaben mitwirkt:
-
GMP-gerechte durchführen von IPC-Analysen gem. spezifischen Analysen-Vorschriften wünschenswert gesammelte Erfahrungen im Umgang mit hochaktiven Substanzen (diese können jedoch während der Einarbeitung angeeignet werden)
-
Mitarbeit bei der GMP gerechten Durchführung der Produktionsansätze vor Ort in der Produktion
-
Bedienung und Überwachung von Anlagen mittels Prozessleitsystem
-
Bedienung und elektronische Dokumentation im Manufacturing Execution System (MES)
-
Durchführen/Mitarbeit im Probenmanagement im Bau 91
-
Überwachung des qualifizierten Zustands der Analysegeräte sowie Mitarbeit beim Geräteunterhalt
-
Bedienung und elektronische Dokumentation im Manufacturing Execution System (MES)
-
Beheben von Störungen im Verantwortungsbereich
-
Mitarbeit / Stellvertretung bei der Betreuung der Rückstellmuster
-
Mitarbeit bei der Wartung- und Instandhaltung von Anlagen und Geräten
-
Erstellen / Review von GMP-Dokumenten (Analysenrohdaten, Qualifizierungsdokumente etc.) sowie Freigabe von Analyseresultaten
-
Bereitschaft in einem mehrschichtigen Betrieb zu arbeiten
Wer Sie sind
Sie sind offen für neue Ideen und hinterfragen konventionelle Denkmuster. Sie schätzen es, in einer leistungsorientierten Umgebung zu arbeiten, die von gegenseitigem Respekt, Diskussion und Zusammenarbeit getragen wird. Dann ist Roche für Sie der Ausgangspunkt für ein spannendes und internationales Arbeitsumfeld mit vielfältigen Entwicklungschancen.
Zusätzlich erfüllen Sie folgende Voraussetzungen:
-
Abgeschlossen Berufsausbildung, vorzugsweise Laborant / Chemikant oder Pharmatechnologe mit 3-5 Jahren Berufserfahrung
-
Idealerweise Erfahrung in Biotechnologie oder Umgang mit Kat. 3b/4-Substanzen
-
Gutes GMP Verständnis GMP-gerechte Durchführung und Dokumentation ihrer Aufgaben im Bereich
-
Information des Vorgesetzten bei allfälligen besonderen Vorkommnissen
-
Vertraulichkeit aller personenbezogenen und sensiblen Betriebsdaten
-
Förderung und Aufrechterhaltung eines kollegialen u. leistungsorientierten Arbeitsklimas
-
kostenbewusstes Arbeiten u. Optimierung der Prozesse
-
Sicherheit, Ordnung und Sauberkeit im Arbeitsbereich
-
konstruktive Zusammenarbeit mit anderen Abteilungen zur Erfüllung der beschriebenen Aufgaben
Bei Fragen prüfen Sie bitte unsere FAQs und Videos unter: careers.roche.ch/faq
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
Manufacturing, Manufacturing > Manufacturing Facilities & Engineering

job.title: Product Owner Customer Experience Insights and Measurement
job.plaincontent:
We are committed to delivering the best possible diagnostic solutions to improve people's lives. We believe balanced healthcare depends on diagnostics, and as the leader in the industry, we continue to shape healthcare delivery, to optimize healthcare resources, and to ultimately benefit society as a whole.
The position
As a Product Owner (PO) Customer Experience (CX) Insights and Measurement, you will have a key role in ensuring the success of the Roche Customer Experience Transformation. In this position, you will measure the success of our customer experience initiatives, analyse customer needs along relevant customer journeys and support the action taking to improve the customer experience along those journeys based on the generated customer insights. To support this goal, you will be responsible to define the best ways to understand and anticipate customer needs and to share the related insights across the organisation in the most meaningful way with relevant user groups. You independently own the interaction with all involved parties such as Global Functions and Regions/Affiliates by building strong personal relationships. As part of an empowered multi-disciplinary team of high performing individuals, you challenge the status quo with an innovative attitude, design-led approach, iterative development, and customer as well as internal end-user involvement. You will benefit from a broad exposure across various areas of Roche Diagnostics and be highly transparent as a key contributor within a high priority global Digital Transformation program.
As PO in Customer Experience Insights and Measurement, you drive transactional CX research along relevant customer journeys together with multi-disciplinary teams and subject matter experts from global functions, regions and affiliates
- Design and implementation of global of customer feedback surveys to understand the perceived CX we offer to our customers - Ideation of additional data needs to even better understand customer needs together with business users and customers - Analysis of the collected insights to derive actionable recommendations on operational and strategic level in order to improve CX by using respective technology and by collaborating with data-savvy colleagues, e.g. data scientists - Identification and implementation of the most actionable way to integrate the generated recommendations on operational level in customer and business processes, e.g. close-the-loop activities - Ideation of potential strategic improvement levers along the customer journey - Realization of continuous improvements, e.g. adaptations of surveys, integration of additional data or extension to customer journey analytics to proactively improve CX
Your strong leadership and decision-making skills, as well as your high customer focus, are key for this role: you will work together with and guide a cross-functional team with competencies ranging from market research to data science
- These product teams are empowered to address customers and business needs and strive to use holistic customer insights to provide actionable recommendations on how to improve CX to customer-facing and digital colleagues - They follow agile ways of working (‘test and learn for iterative development’, ‘directly involve selected customers throughout entire development’, ‘strong team empowerment’) - You ensure that the outcomes, i.e. generated insights and actionable recommendations, are focused on improved customer experience at all times and enable action-taking of various end-user groups - You ensure that the team designs the research incl. new surveys in line with global standards - You bring in customer- and user-perspective in by involving internal colleagues and customers, where applicable, early on - You ensure exchange of best practices across the organisation and continuous improvement even after implementation
You will interact and collaborate with stakeholders on multiple levels across business functions, regions and business areas
- You will get insights into a broad range of topics along the entire customer journey from marketing/sales over service to account management and retention - You will work strongly together with global capability functions such as DIA IT and DIA UX - You ensure strong alignment and engagement with all involved parties - You will drive capability building for insights-related topics (e.g., advance analytics) in selected parts of the organization, where feasible, to support organizational readiness for CX Insights and Measurement
As a member of the Digital Transformation Office you additionally support the team
- Influence decision-making on digital topics and support communications on progress updates from the DTO - Serve as authority for digital and CX activities across Diagnostics, identify existing gaps, overlaps and opportunities - Lead or contribute to additional activities supporting the Digital Transformation facilitated by the DTO, e.g. workshops with different internal and external partners
Who you are?
- Master or PhD with a focus on business, maths, statistics or data science / econometrics - Leader with experience in a global environment, ideally at the interface of business and digital/IT - Experienced to work in an agile, highly collaborative and fast-paced environment where co-development with internal end-users and customers is at the core - Deep empathy for the customer’s working processes & daily challenges and commitment to always provide the best experience possible - Strong practical knowledge of agile methodologies and working together with a multi-disciplinary team with data-savvy colleagues - Ability and proficiency to work with and influence leadership team members - Strong interpersonal skills and a strong collaborative mind-set - Ambitious and comfortable to work with limited supervision - Ability to handle ambiguity and to manage organizational and content complexity - Ambitious attitude and perseverance to find solutions in an area novel for Roche Diagnostics - Ability to quickly seize business opportunities - Solution-focused thinking, ability to make decisions - Comprehensive understanding of the current trends and best practices in customer and customer journey analytics - Previous experience in a fast-paced, innovative environment (e.g. in a startup, tech, consulting...) is a clear advantage - Previous experience in building and running CX Measurement systems, conducting CX-related research and / or customer (journey) analytics is a clear advantage - Proficiency in English
Are you ready to apply? We are looking a person who thinks beyond the job offered - someone who knows that this position can be a rare springboard to many other opportunities at Roche.
Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building teams that represent a range of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.
Roche ist ein Arbeitgeber, bei dem Chancengleichheit zählt.
Geschäftsentwicklung, Geschäftsentwicklung > Strategic Business Development

  • Realization of continuous improvements, e.g. adaptations of surveys, integration of additional data or extension to customer journey analytics to proactively improve CX

Your strong leadership and decision-making skills, as well as your high customer focus, are key for this role: you will work together with and guide a cross-functional team with competencies ranging from market research to data science

  • These product teams are empowered to address customers and business needs and strive to use holistic customer insights to provide actionable recommendations on how to improve CX to customer-facing and digital colleagues
  • They follow agile ways of working (‘test and learn for iterative development’, ‘directly involve selected customers throughout entire development’, ‘strong team empowerment’)

Who you are?

  • Master or PhD with a focus on business, maths, statistics or data science / econometrics
  • Leader with experience in a global environment, ideally at the interface of business and digital/IT
  • Experienced to work in an agile, highly collaborative and fast-paced environment where co-development with internal end-users and customers is at the core
  • Deep empathy for the customer’s working processes & daily challenges and commitment to always provide the best experience possible
  • Strong practical knowledge of agile methodologies and working together with a multi-disciplinary team with data-savvy colleagues
  • Ability and proficiency to work with and influence leadership team members
  • Strong interpersonal skills and a strong collaborative mind-set
  • Ambitious and comfortable to work with limited supervision
  • Ability to handle ambiguity and to manage organizational and content complexity
  • Ambitious attitude and perseverance to find solutions in an area novel for Roche Diagnostics
  • Ability to quickly seize business opportunities
  • Solution-focused thinking, ability to make decisions
  • Comprehensive understanding of the current trends and best practices in customer and customer journey analytics
  • Previous experience in a fast-paced, innovative environment (e.g. in a startup, tech, consulting...) is a clear advantage
  • Previous experience in building and running CX Measurement systems, conducting CX-related research and / or customer (journey) analytics is a clear advantage

Are you ready to apply? We are looking a person who thinks beyond the job offered - someone who knows that this position can be a rare springboard to many other opportunities at Roche.

Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building teams that represent a range of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

job.title: Senior IT Auditor
job.plaincontent:
As an independent function within the Roche Group, Group Audit provides assurance to the Senior Management and the Board of Directors by assessing the inherent risks managed by the organisation is, as well as the efficiency and compliance of business operations. Within Group Audit, the North America and Group Functions team is in charge of assessing IT organisations and processes. We are a multicultural and dynamic team based in Basel, Switzerland.
As a Senior IT Auditor:
-
You will be responsible to assess risks, lead and deliver (primarily) IT audits across multiple disciplines, including:
-
IT Governance and alignment to business objectives
-
Project and programme reviews, incl. organisational transformation and Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
-
IT security, infrastructure and networks
-
Emerging and disruptive technologies (e.g. robotics process automation, artificial intelligence, etc.)
-
Data and information governance
-
You will partner with stakeholders, including senior leaders of the IT organisation, to develop an understanding of their organisations. You will execute the scope of the audits, communicate the results and make recommendations.
-
You will also be responsible to follow up on issues and actions to ensure they are completed satisfactorily.
-
The position involves travel world-wide (approx. 30%).
Main requirements:
-
Proven experience (7 – 10 years) as Internal IT Auditor, or strategic consulting (Big4) on IT projects.
-
You have solid academic credentials (university degree), ideally in IT or business administration.
-
Business proficiency in English (written and verbal) is a must, further languages are an advantage.
-
Solid technical acumen is required in IT. While you do not need to be an expert in all of the areas listed above, you should have an appreciation of many of them. Process and risk knowledge is a distinct differentiation.
-
Strong team player and excellent communication/influencing/negotiating skills.
-
Critical thinking, growth mindset and analytical skills are essential characteristics to drive success in this role. Check our video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YHS545Cpgmw
If you have questions, then please check our FAQs and videos oncareers.roche.ch/faq.
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
Audit & Compliance, Audit & Compliance > Audit

As a Senior IT Auditor:

  • You will be responsible to assess risks, lead and deliver (primarily) IT audits across multiple disciplines, including:

    • IT Governance and alignment to business objectives

    • Project and programme reviews, incl. organisational transformation and Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC)

    • IT security, infrastructure and networks

    • Emerging and disruptive technologies (e.g. robotics process automation, artificial intelligence, etc.)

    • Data and information governance

  • You will partner with stakeholders, including senior leaders of the IT organisation, to develop an understanding of their organisations. You will execute the scope of the audits, communicate the results and make recommendations.

  • You will also be responsible to follow up on issues and actions to ensure they are completed satisfactorily.

  • The position involves travel world-wide (approx. 30%).

 

Main requirements:

  • Proven experience (7 – 10 years) as Internal IT Auditor, or strategic consulting (Big4) on IT projects.

  • You have solid academic credentials (university degree), ideally in IT or business administration.

  • Business proficiency in English (written and verbal) is a must, further languages are an advantage.

  • Solid technical acumen is required in IT. While you do not need to be an expert in all of the areas listed above, you should have an appreciation of many of them. Process and risk knowledge is a distinct differentiation.

  • Strong team player and excellent communication/influencing/negotiating skills.

  • Critical thinking, growth mindset and analytical skills are essential characteristics to drive success in this role.
    Check our video:
    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YHS545Cpgmw

    If you have questions, then please check our FAQs and videos oncareers.roche.ch/faq.

Roche is an equal opportunity employer.

Audit & Compliance, Audit & Compliance > Audit

job.title: Integrated Strategy Leader
job.plaincontent:
Global Product Strategy (GPS) drives Roche’s strategy and portfolio of products - from research through to patients. As a member of GPS, you will be part of a truly international group who collaborates with functions and affiliates worldwide to shape the future of medicine.
As Integrated Strategy Leader (iSL), you are the global commercialization accountable person for all relevant indications, leading a fit-for-purpose team (iSquad) that includes cross-functional leaders representing key markets, and from global Access, Medical, Marketing and potentially other functions as you judge appropriate to the business needs. As an LCT member, you are accountable for the business globally ensuring timely, accurate and meaningful representation of the iSquad at the LCT.
You define the composition of your iSquad (i.e. global functional and affiliate representatives) and craft culture and set behavioral norms and expectations to build conditions for the operating principles of the model to flourish.
You embody in-service leadership, developing all iSquad members through mentoring and feedback. You set the tone for a development and people-focused organization and collaborate with functional leadership to share feedback and ensure optimal success for all team members. You also manage a team of direct reports.
You co-create a single integrated strategic plan (ISP), along with Marketing, Medical and Access and/or other representatives, integrate cross-functional considerations that ensures our development and commercialization plans improve both patient and commercial value of the assigned product and productively implement globally.
Please note - there are currently multiple iSL openings available in Basel.
As an isl, you are primarily accountable for:
To act as a single point of contact for International Heads (US, I-8, SMC leadership) and PLT regarding commercialization strategy Direct Interface to the leadership (GMs/PSDs/IFLs) of the International 8 (Canada, Germany, France, Spain, Italy, UK, China, Brazil) and US (Franchise Heads/Squad Leads/ Marketing Directors): Ensure the ISP will improve patient and business value in US and I-8. Define success metrics and advise leadership on appropriate resource investments to implement the strategy. Influence in-market implementation plans to be consistent with the integrated strategy. Co-create solutions and define appropriate trade-offs where the strategy may not be flawless for a local market. Advise GM on resources and trade-offs for achieving local targets. Define the brand ambition and work dedicatedly with US and I-8 leadership to achieve or exceed business targets. Approve and evolve leading and lagging strategy and execution indicators by key market to identify new opportunities or enable course corrections. Be a sounding board and constructive challenger to their US and I8 partners. Review and approve 3-year revenue forecast package guidance for key markets and develop assumptions plus assess and approve the output of 10-year probabilistic forecasting. Inform quarterly qualitative insights into CY+1 business outlook performance drivers, opportunities and challenges. Develop, approve, and evaluate a global P&L for key opportunities to evolve global strategies and influence local resource allocation/mix to improve value. Develop and handle the global budget. Leading and ensuring timely, useful communications to all markets, even those not sitting on iSquad.
We are searching for candidates who possess:
A Bachelors Degree (marketing, business management or life sciences discipline is helpful) - MBA or other relevant Graduate or Post-Graduate Degree is well regarded At least 10 multidisciplinary experience in the pharmaceutical/ biotechnology industry. Significant pharmaceutical customer-facing experience, preferably in both global and country-level positions. This includes product management, sales/sales management, medical, access, and/or customer facing roles with accountability for delivering results. Motivational leader skills with shown results in people leadership and talent development in a multi-cultural environment; must have at least 4 or more years’ people leadership experience.
A deep understanding of Roche's therapeutic areas, the markets Roche operate in and the patients we serve (a must have). A track record of effective strategic commercial decisions, including effective organizational alignment for such. Delivery of impactful presentations to senior management and the external environment. Shown effective, agile, fit-for-purpose leadership of cross-functional teams. Good knowledge of the drug development and commercialization processes, reimbursement environment, regulatory and compliance requirements In-depth knowledge of commercial budgeting and forecasting processes Shown success in understanding complex scientific issues and effectively translating these into business success Multicultural awareness
Are you ready to apply? We are looking for someone who thinks beyond the job offered - someone who knows that this position can be a rare springboard to many other opportunities at Roche. When applying for this position, already project yourself in the future. Think about what could come next and how you would like to build your future.
If you have questions then please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq.
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
Sales & Marketing, Sales & Marketing > Product Life Cycle Management

As Integrated Strategy Leader (iSL), you are the global commercialization accountable person for all relevant indications, leading a fit-for-purpose team (iSquad) that includes cross-functional leaders representing key markets, and from global Access, Medical, Marketing and potentially other functions as you judge appropriate to the business needs. job.title: Director, Business Development, Pharma Partnering
job.plaincontent:
At Roche, we believe it’s urgent to deliver medical solutions right now – even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients’ lives and we are daring in both decision and action. And we believe that good business means a better world. That is why we come to work each day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigour, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow.
This position is with Pharma Partnering where e are passionate about science: yours and ours. Through partnerships we can build a better future together with medicines and diagnostics that make a real difference to patients. Our approach to partnering is open and flexible; with a creative approach to deal structuring that is as dynamic and enterprising as ever. We are proud that our alliance management is recognised amongst the best in the industry.
- Closely collaborating with R&D and Global Product Strategy leaders to define areas of interest and to develop and execute the partnering strategy for those areas - Sourcing new therapeutic opportunities that are consistent with the company’s scientific and business objectives, including preparing in-depth opportunity landscapes, attending scientific and partnering conferences, and networking with biotechs, venture capitalists, academia and biopharmaceutical companies - Driving decision-making and the deal process, and making presentations and recommendations to senior management - Leading scientific and strategic assessments and cross-functional due diligence reviews - Developing and recommending proposed deal structures and financial terms, and leading negotiations of term sheets and contracts with potential partners in collaboration with Legal and Finance - Coaching and mentoring other BDPLs on all aspects of the deal process - Travel as needed for negotiations and for building coalitions of support for key deals across Roche
Requirements
- An advanced degree in life sciences, medicine or data science. An MBA or JD, or an equivalent combination of scientific and business education and experience is helpful, e.g., strategy consulting experience. - High level of expertise of business development or transactional experience with a track record of leading and successfully completing complex or high impact transactions in life sciences, diagnostics or personalized health care; experience with both preclinical and clinical therapeutic opportunities preferred - Proven ability to build and lead teams, drive business decisions, and manage multiple projects effectively in a fast-paced environment - Energetic, result-driven, self-starter with a strong executive presence, collaborative mindset, and ability to think strategically and analytically - Solid understanding of the drug/technology/diagnostic discovery, development and commercialization process, and demonstrated ability to effectively collaborate with R&D leadership; knowledge of the therapeutic and partnering landscape within a sector of interest to Roche is a plus - A verifiable reputation of integrity, resilience, fairness, collegiality and passion for supporting difficult, data-driven decisions in support of driving or walking-away from deals - Good business instincts and fluency with business analytics and valuation methodologies - Superb oral and written communication, interpersonal, influence and negotiation skills - Skilful presenter of scientific and business topics to executives
Location: Basel Headquarter
Are you ready to apply? We are looking a person who thinks beyond the job offered - someone who knows that this position can be a rare springboard to many other opportunities at Roche.
Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building teams that represents a range of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.
If you still have questions then please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq.
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.

job.title: ASPIRE Senior Audit Coordinator
job.plaincontent:
ASPIRE is a business process transformation program utilizing technology as an enabler and is established as a cross-divisional initiative among Pharma Technical Operations and Pharma Sales Affiliates, Group Finance and Procurement and Informatics. ASPIRE will streamline process complexity and simplify system landscapes, contributing to Roche's response to industry challenges such as Personalized healthcare, increased competitions and disruptive technologies.
Your main responsibilities include:
- Coordinate all audit activities for ASPIRE and you will be the single point of contact for all internal and external audits - Support the Program Team during all audits as well as for pre and post audit activities by ensuring - You have a general awareness of the project teams and you make sure that all Audit activities are properly incorporated into the program and project plans. Further you established Quality assurance processes consider audit requirements accordingly - Reporting to the program management team and will work closely with the PMO functions and the functional work streams including integration management - Ensure all audit findings are documented in the respective Program Trackers accordingly and will handle all follow-up actions as needed and report to the respective governance boards of the program/projects - Responsible for raising issues to the program management and initiate actions as required
Who are you?
You possess a Master's degree or equivalent experience in the respective functional area, Business Administration, or related field and have 5+ years related business experience, ideally in an audit role.
Following qualifications are required:
- Solid skills and knowledge in the operational business and have an in-depth understanding of business processes - Highly developed expertise with regard to project management as well as coaching both individuals and teams - Able to influence your customers and business partners during presentations and project meetings and communicate in a manner appropriate to your target audience in the process - Thought leader in respective area and demonstrated ability to inspire and foster collaborative relationships with ability to engage resources outside of direct-control to gain consensus, meet deadlines and achieve goals and objectives - Strong stakeholder management, change management skill and outstanding customer service mindset and interpersonal skills - Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
If you still have questions then please check our FAQs and videos oncareers.roche.ch/faq
Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.

job.title: Business Solution Analyst Extended Warehouse Management IT
job.plaincontent:
At Roche, we believe it’s urgent to deliver medical solutions right now – even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients’ lives. We are brave in both decision and action, we believe that good business means a better world.
The Business Solution Analyst – ERP EMEA D2S, expert (SAP eWM), joins a team of talented, creative, and motivated SAP Business Solution Analysts within ERP Informatics accountable for delivering solutions to Roche’s global Product and Supply Chain Management business unit. This position has a very high level of customer interaction and will contribute to projects, enhancements, and maintenance activities related to our SAP instances dedicated to Supply Change Management area.
This position reports functionally to the Team Head, ERP EMEA O2C, F2P and D2S and will be based in Kaiseraugst Switzerland. In order to support a Regional users' base, this role requires the ability to travel internationally up to 10% as needed.
Key responsibilities:
- Design, build, test, deploy, maintain, and improve existing system functionality; develop new features per business requirements and create system documentation, including functional and technical specifications, test plans, and scripts. - Can influence decisions within area. - Ensure validation, audit, and legal compliance of system throughout lifecycle. - Provide content knowledge on Incident, Problem, and ‎Change management processes to appropriate IT teams and collaborate with other IT teams to implement solutions that optimize operational performance of system. - Drive coordination of activities for small-to-medium changes in area of ‎responsibility; provide 2nd/3rd level support and involved in Projects - Help drive process improvement initiatives to optimize user experience and business understanding of solution.
Who You Are:
You actively pursue new ideas and question conventional thought patterns. You appreciate working in a dynamic organization with ambitious goals and an environment characterized by mutual respect, open dialogue and collaboration across numerous global and local interfaces.
For this position, the ideal candidate brings the following qualifications:
- 5 years or more of SAP eWM – extended Warehouse Management configuration experience and detailed knowledge of integrating eWM with corresponding SAP ECC components including Material and Quality Management. SAP Certification in eWM (desirable) and MM, QM (optional). - Knowledge of the CIF and qRFC interface. - Experience as a consultant, functional expert, or similar role highly desirable. Experience conducting large-scale requirements and design sessions with business process owners. - Skilled in problem/incident management, experience working in ITIL and Project Management environments, SLAs – Service Level Agreements and full lifecycle system support - Must be a self-starter, results-oriented and have a track record of timely, high-quality deliverables and Ability to work with remote and virtual teams - Excellent verbal/written communication skills in German and English; strong presentation and negotiation/conflict resolution skills. - Experience in pharmaceutical, biotech, or other validated environment highly desired
Do you have any questions? Please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.

job.title: VP and Head, Translational Medicine
job.plaincontent:
Roche is leading global research-driven healthcare company based in Basel, Switzerland, with major strengths in pharmaceuticals and diagnostics. Roche is the largest biotechnology company in the world focused on marketing and developing medicines in oncology, neuroscience and rare diseases, immunology, infectious diseases, and ophthalmology. Roche has over 98’000 employees worldwide and invested 11.7 billion Swiss francs in research and development in 2019. The Roche Group, which includes Genentech and Spark in the United States, had to its credit sales of 61.5 billion Swiss Francs in 2019. Roche also has a majority stake in Chugai, based in Japan.
With 125 years of history in bringing medicines to patients, Roche takes a long-term commitment to research and development. The patient is a constant at the center of Roche’s philosophy and activities. Continuing innovations in precision medicine and digitalization of healthcare place Roche in a unique position to transform science to medicines and improve standards of care for patients worldwide. Roche is advancing access to science and medicines in developed and emerging markets that will provide additional growth opportunities.
Roche has had substantial successes in research and development. Over the past three years Roche pRED has transitioned four programs to late stage clinical development in the areas of neuroscience and rare disease. Our efforts in discovery and early clinical development span multiple indications of unmet medical need in neuroscience, with over 25 novel molecular entities at distinct stages of evaluation. Roche continues to invest heavily in R&D, and is thus poised to accelerate the development of new medicines for patients in the years ahead.
With its long history in neuroscience and strengths across diverse disciplines, Roche is uniquely positioned to lead in transforming science to medicines for patients with disorders of the nervous system. The Neuroscience and Rare Diseases (NRD) Discovery and Translational Area (DTA) group currently has approximately 160 members based in Basel, Switzerland. The Roche neuroscience group within the NRD DTA in Basel and Genentech’s neuroscience group in South San Francisco operate in collaboration and in parallel.
The Position
Roche is seeking a VP and Global Head of Neuroscience Translational Medicine, reporting to SVP and Global Head of the NRD DTA, who will interface with other groups within Roche pRED NRD including Neuroscience Discovery as well as with Roche Late Stage Development to discover molecules that will ultimately become treatments for disorders of the nervous system. The focus of Neuroscience Translational Medicine is to advance early clinical neuroscience development programs through proof of concept studies to late stage development.
Experience
The candidate qualifications include MD or MD/PhD with residency training in adult or pediatric neurology, significant postdoctoral research, and at least 10 years of experience in neuroscience R&D, preferably discovery and development and a demonstrated broad knowledge across R&D-related sciences and practices. A candidate from academia will be an international leader in neurology with a record of accomplishments in translational neuroscience and deep understanding of clinical trials and at least 10 years of experience as an independent investigator subsequent to neurology and postdoctoral training.
The successful candidate will have a deep and broad understanding of diseases of the nervous system, clinical trial design and methodology, biomarkers and diagnostics, and leadership accomplishments. Ideally, the candidate will have a track record of successfully translating molecules from discovery into the clinical setting as well as an understanding of regulatory, payer, and commercial issues in the pharmaceutical industry.
The ideal candidate will have demonstrated competence in the following areas:
-
Scientific accomplishments in translational neuroscience.A key quality sought in our candidates will be scientific accomplishments, insights, and acumen. A strong record of strong scientific insights and success in clinical development or discovery efforts in industry leaders and evidence of scholarship and leadership in a field of study will be sought in academic leaders.
-
Collaborative leadership.The candidate is highly collaborative internally and externally. The role requires a leader who makes decisions in an input-driven manner, inspires others to work together, and the ability to work with peers and a large number of partners across the organization who are not in the line-of-command in order to improve performance and meet goals. The candidate has a track record of encouraging and supervising multiple relationships across academic institutions and industry partners.
-
Strategic vision. In partnership with other leaders in the NRD DTA, the executive will articulate and implement a vision and direction for Neuroscience Translational Medicine. The leader will have the ability to monitor and reassess strategic priorities of the organization. In addition, the executive will articulate long-term opportunities and threats, evaluate options, and take proactive steps to address them. The Global Head of Translational Medicine will also understand how to align the direction of Neuroscience in the context of the NRD DTA, pRED, and Roche enterprise.
-
Results orientation. The candidate understands how to make difficult decisions and will be able to focus on key priorities and delivery toward goals.The executive will have the ability to inspire those around to pursue innovative ideas in the search for new treatments for disorders of the nervous system. The ideal candidate has made strategic decisions and will have implemented them beyond expectations.
-
Team leadership. The successful candidate has established dynamic and thriving groups of investigators in a research setting and has set up an environment that fosters creativity and innovation. The candidate will have the ability to attract diverse individuals with the right overall mix of skills to provide exceptional results. The Global Head of Neuroscience Translational Medicine will have the ability to empower the team and has thorough appreciation of each individual’s contribution, and nimbly creates efforts of the organization accordingly. The executive will inspire and create a strong sense of team spirit in the organization.
Key responsibilities
-
Oversee progression of and provide direction for early clinical portfolio projects from Entry into Human (EIH) through to Proof of Concept (PoC) studies
-
Chair the Development Review Committee (DRC) and provide key insights and guidance for preparation of projects to the pRED Early Stage Portfolio Committee (eSPC)
-
Collaboratively provides scientific and clinical input on the selection and scientific validation of targets, biomarkers and selection of clinical candidates, and study design
-
Jointly accountable for delivery of clear cut decision criteria to select high quality candidates for entry into GLP (EIGLP) as well as critically assess PoC study results and work closely with late stage (LS) leaders toward effective strategies in LS development through to post-launch
-
Through line management responsibilities, inspire a talented team of Translational Medicine Leaders and Clinical Scientists with diverse skills and backgrounds
-
Serve as a core member of the Neuroscience and Rare Diseases (NRD) Leadership Team (NLT) to develop and implement strategy for target identification, drug discovery, and early clinical development in the NRD
-
Oversee the allocation of internal and external resources to support early clinical development projects
-
Lead in the effective integration and execution of internalized and externalized Neuroscience portfolio projects in collaboration with Roche Partnering
-
Explore and implement collaborations with industry and academia to increase understanding of disease biology and facilitate the prosecution of portfolio in early clinical development
-
Represent Roche in public-private partnerships related to early clinical development for disorders of the nervous system
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
Research & Development, Research & Development > Clinical Development
job.htmlcontent:
Roche is leading global research-driven healthcare company based in Basel, Switzerland, with major strengths in pharmaceuticals and diagnostics. Roche is the largest biotechnology company in the world focused on marketing and developing medicines in oncology, neuroscience and rare diseases, immunology, infectious diseases, and ophthalmology.  Roche has over 98’000 employees worldwide and invested 11.7 billion Swiss francs in research and development in 2019. The Roche Group, which includes Genentech and Spark in the United States, had to its credit sales of 61.5 billion Swiss Francs in 2019. Roche also has a majority stake in Chugai, based in Japan.

With 125 years of history in bringing medicines to patients, Roche takes a long-term commitment to research and development. The patient is a constant at the center of Roche’s philosophy and activities. Continuing innovations in precision medicine and digitalization of healthcare place Roche in a unique position to transform science to medicines and improve standards of care for patients worldwide. Roche is advancing access to science and medicines in developed and emerging markets that will provide additional growth opportunities.

Roche has had substantial successes in research and development. Over the past three years Roche pRED has transitioned four programs to late stage clinical development in the areas of neuroscience and rare disease. Our efforts in discovery and early clinical development span multiple indications of unmet medical need in neuroscience, with over 25 novel molecular entities at distinct stages of evaluation. Roche continues to invest heavily in R&D, and is thus poised to accelerate the development of new medicines for patients in the years ahead.

With its long history in neuroscience and strengths across diverse disciplines, Roche is uniquely positioned to lead in transforming science to medicines for patients with disorders of the nervous system. The Neuroscience and Rare Diseases (NRD) Discovery and Translational Area (DTA) group currently has approximately 160 members based in Basel, Switzerland. The Roche neuroscience group within the NRD DTA in Basel and Genentech’s neuroscience group in South San Francisco operate in collaboration and in parallel.

The Position 

Roche is seeking a VP and Global Head of Neuroscience Translational Medicine, reporting to SVP and Global Head of the NRD DTA, who will interface with other groups within Roche pRED NRD including Neuroscience Discovery as well as with Roche Late Stage Development to discover molecules that will ultimately become treatments for disorders of the nervous system. The focus of Neuroscience Translational Medicine is to advance early clinical neuroscience development programs through proof of concept studies to late stage development.

Experience

The candidate qualifications include MD or MD/PhD with residency training in adult or pediatric neurology, significant postdoctoral research, and at least 10 years of experience in neuroscience R&D, preferably discovery and development and a demonstrated broad knowledge across R&D-related sciences and practices. A candidate from academia will be an international leader in neurology with a record of accomplishments in translational neuroscience and deep understanding of clinical trials and at least 10 years of experience as an independent investigator subsequent to neurology and postdoctoral training. 

The successful candidate will have a deep and broad understanding of diseases of the nervous system, clinical trial design and methodology, biomarkers and diagnostics, and leadership accomplishments. Ideally, the candidate will have a track record of successfully translating molecules from discovery into the clinical setting as well as an understanding of regulatory, payer, and commercial issues in the pharmaceutical industry. 

 

The ideal candidate will have demonstrated competence in the following areas:

  • Scientific accomplishments in translational neuroscience.A key quality sought in our candidates will be scientific accomplishments, insights, and acumen. A strong record of strong scientific insights and success in clinical development or discovery efforts in industry leaders and evidence of scholarship and leadership in a field of study will be sought in academic leaders. 

  • Collaborative leadership.The candidate is highly collaborative internally and externally. The role requires a leader who makes decisions in an input-driven manner, inspires others to work together, and the ability to work with peers and a large number of partners across the organization who are not in the line-of-command in order to improve performance and meet goals. The candidate has a track record of encouraging and supervising multiple relationships across academic institutions and industry partners.

  • Strategic vision. In partnership with other leaders in the NRD DTA, the executive will articulate and implement a vision and direction for Neuroscience Translational Medicine. The leader will have the ability to monitor and reassess strategic priorities of the organization. In addition, the executive will articulate long-term opportunities and threats, evaluate options, and take proactive steps to address them. The Global Head of Translational Medicine will also understand how to align the direction of Neuroscience in the context of the NRD DTA, pRED, and Roche enterprise.

  • Results orientation. The candidate understands how to make difficult decisions and will be able to focus on key priorities and delivery toward goals.The executive will have the ability to inspire those around to pursue innovative ideas in the search for new treatments for disorders of the nervous system. The ideal candidate has made strategic decisions and will have implemented them beyond expectations.

  • Team leadership. The successful candidate has established dynamic and thriving groups of investigators in a research setting and has set up an environment that fosters creativity and innovation. The candidate will have the ability to attract diverse individuals with the right overall mix of skills to provide exceptional results. The Global Head of Neuroscience Translational Medicine will have the ability to empower the team and has thorough appreciation of each individual’s contribution, and nimbly creates efforts of the organization accordingly. The executive will inspire and create a strong sense of team spirit in the organization. 

Key responsibilities

  • Oversee progression of and provide direction for early clinical portfolio projects from Entry into Human (EIH) through to Proof of Concept (PoC) studies

  • Chair the Development Review Committee (DRC) and provide key insights and guidance for preparation of projects to the pRED Early Stage Portfolio Committee (eSPC)

  • Collaboratively provides scientific and clinical input on the selection and scientific validation of targets, biomarkers and selection of clinical candidates, and study design

  • Jointly accountable for delivery of clear cut decision criteria to select high quality candidates for entry into GLP (EIGLP) as well as critically assess PoC study results and work closely with late stage (LS) leaders toward effective strategies in LS development through to post-launch 

  • Through line management responsibilities, inspire a talented team of Translational Medicine Leaders and Clinical Scientists with diverse skills and backgrounds

  • Serve as a core member of the Neuroscience and Rare Diseases (NRD) Leadership Team (NLT) to develop and implement strategy for target identification, drug discovery, and early clinical development in the NRD

  • Oversee the allocation of internal and external resources to support early clinical development projects

  • Lead in the effective integration and execution of internalized and externalized Neuroscience portfolio projects in collaboration with Roche Partnering

  • Explore and implement collaborations with industry and academia to increase understanding of disease biology and facilitate the prosecution of portfolio in early clinical development

  • Represent Roche in public-private partnerships related to early clinical development for disorders of the nervous system 

Roche is an equal opportunity employer.

Research & Development, Research & Development > Clinical Development

job.title: Biomarker Data Scientist
job.plaincontent:
Who We Are
At Roche, we believe it’s urgent to deliver medical solutions right now – even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients’ lives and we are fearless in both decision and action. That is why we come to work each day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigor, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow.
You will be part of the Translational Sciences Oncology (TSO) initiative of Roche Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED) Oncology. The TSO group combines the existing expertise of Discovery Cancer Immunotherapy (CIT) and Early Biomarker Development Oncology (EBDO) departments into a cross-functional team nurturing our mission to transform pioneering scientific discoveries into effective medicines. The CIT team consists of cancer immunology and quantitative biology scientists conceiving innovative ways to fight cancer. The EBDO team consists of biomarker experts and scientists supporting drug development by designing and implementing precision medicine strategies aiming at selecting the right molecule for the right patient and enhancing our understanding of disease biology. Together, we form a team striving to augment and accelerate translation of preclinical and clinical findings into innovative biomarker strategies to provide proof of mechanism and patient stratification and/or selection options. Built on a diversity of skills and expertise such as immunologists, oncologists, pathologists, imaging scientists, biomarker experts and data scientists, TSO promotes pRED Oncology vision to develop curative medicines for cancer patients.
As an Oncology Biomarker Data Scientist, you will be embedded into both EBDO and CIT groups to enable and support reverse translational research of multiple biomarker data types and generate insights. You will also be part of an internal network of data scientists enabling cross-learnings, methodology sharing and improvement, and insight sharing.
The Position
Your mission will be to analyze and interpret preclinical and clinical biomarker data to support reverse translation (e.g. characterize tumor heterogeneity, identify resistance mechanisms to cancer therapies, drive scientific innovation, etc.).
Here is a glimpse into some responsibilities and activities:
- Analysis and interpretation of multiple biomarker data types, with a focus on high-dimensional single cells data, retrieval and analysis of such biomarker data from Roche and external repositories, providing fit for purpose analytical and statistical methods - Development and application of statistical methods and mathematical models building integrated multimodal statistical framework for interpretation and predictive usage of heterogeneous patient-derived data (low- and high-dimensional data, functional in-vitro data) - Integrate pharmacology, pharmacodynamic and other biomarker datasets using state-of-the-art data computer programming approaches enabling quantitative analysis - Design and deliver advanced quantitative data analyses using large/complex datasets - Develop and manage data analytics solutions, provide new capabilities and services to enable decision-making and insight generation - Quickly recognize and mitigate data quality problems - Translate business needs into functional and technical requirements for data management, reporting and visualization activities - Collaborate within cross-functional teams to develop solutions, gain alignment and deliver impactful business insights - Coordinate multiple data analysis projects and help defining the optimal resources/skills allocations (including internal and external resources) - Be at the forefront of methods development and actively evaluate their potential and possible contribution to TSO goals - Openly share perspective and insights to elevate team thinking and drive a balanced, holistic point of view
Who You Are
You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You are looking for a company where you receive the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Working in a multicultural environment motivates you. As a fast learner you actively drive the quality of the requirements.
If you have these qualifications and skills, we look forward to receiving your application:
- PhD in life or engineering sciences, with emphasis in biotechnology, data science, computer science, biostatistics, or related discipline - Good understanding of Immunology and Cancer Biology is mandatory for this role - Experienced in reverse translation in the field of Cancer Immunotherapy - Proven track record of generating and analyzing high dimensional single cell data (CyTOF, scRNAseq); experience in spatial transcriptomics and proteomics is a plus - Shown experience with handling/analyzing clinical biomarker data - Experience in working in a multidisciplinary and clinical development environment is a plus - Proficient in one or more programming language (R, Python, Matlab, C++ and/or SAS) - Passionate about data science and drug development - Good communicator that can engage with senior leadership and communicate data science activities and achievements - Executing scientific rigor - High organizational skills and a strong capacity to focus on complex tasks - High capabilities to efficiently work in a matrix team environment, analyzing different viewpoints and pro-actively propose constructive solutions
If you are proud of contributing and feel you have the dedication to teamwork and innovation that we are seeking, then Roche is the organization for you. Every role at Roche plays a part in making a difference to patients’ lives. If you want to work in a passionate team, make your mark & improve lives, apply now.
Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
If you have questions, please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq.
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
Research & Development, Research & Development > Research

Who You Are

You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You are looking for a company where you receive the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Working in a multicultural environment motivates you. As a fast learner you actively drive the quality of the requirements.

If you have these qualifications and skills, we look forward to receiving your application:

  • Proven track record of generating and analyzing high dimensional single cell data (CyTOF, scRNAseq); experience in spatial transcriptomics and proteomics is a plus
  • Shown experience with handling/analyzing clinical biomarker data
  • Experience in working in a multidisciplinary and clinical development environment is a plus
  • Proficient in one or more programming language (R, Python, Matlab, C++ and/or SAS)
  • Passionate about data science and drug development
  • Good communicator that can engage with senior leadership and communicate data science activities and achievements
  • Executing scientific rigor
  • High organizational skills and a strong capacity to focus on complex tasks
  • High capabilities to efficiently work in a matrix team environment, analyzing different viewpoints and pro-actively propose constructive solutions

If you are proud of contributing and feel you have the dedication to teamwork and innovation that we are seeking, then Roche is the organization for you. Every role at Roche plays a part in making a difference to patients’ lives. If you want to work in a passionate team, make your mark & improve lives, apply now.

Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be and we value diversity at our company. job.title: Join our Portfolio Planning and Decision Analysis Leader talent pool!
job.plaincontent:
We continuously seek for great talents to join our Strategy Portfolio team! Interested in helping build, maintain and grow to success Roche`s early drug development portfolio? Apply to the role and get in contact with us!
Job description
At Roche, we believe it’s urgent to deliver medical solutions right now – even as we develop innovations for the future. We are passionate about transforming patients’ lives and we are brave in both decision and action. And we believe that good business means a better world. That is why we come to work each day.
We commit ourselves to scientific rigour, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow. As a valued partner for effective decision-making, project, and clinical study execution, the Strategy Portfolio & Clinical Operations Function (SP&CO) maximizes Pharma Research and Early Development’s (pRED) portfolio value by enabling teams to progress projects efficiently & effectively, providing objective analysis and strategic context and by executing the clinical studies that bring medicine to patients The Portfolio Planning and Decision Analysis (PPDA) team’s mission is to help achieve an optimum balance of risk vs. reward across the pRED portfolio. This means focusing on how we can maximize R&D productivity by acting as a strategic consultant and partner to our Senior Leaders. Correspondingly, we support decision-making at project and portfolio level as projects progress from CCS to LIP. Members of the PPDA team have an in-depth understanding of research and development and combine this with a profound knowledge of the healthcare and pharmaceutical business. Through our timely analysis and metrics, teams can use our expertise to ensure that decisions made help increase project PTS, decrease the cost of molecule development and minimize the cost of failure.
The Position The position reports to the Head of Pharma Research and Early Development (pRED) Portfolio Planning and Decision Analysis. You will work with governance committees and senior executives as well as project teams to optimize project plans and portfolio strategy by providing portfolio insight and analytics and developing portfolio strategies. Your responsibilities include:
- Providing teams with decision analysis and strategic support to ensure alignment with portfolio priorities and advise teams on internal governance processes - Handling the research governance process, business management and meeting templates - Facilitating annual prioritization, goal setting, lifecycle and business planning processes - Preparing regular reports on progress of research portfolio and implications (incl. strategic context) and provide input to cross-portfolio reports - Being the point person for new methodologies that are developed for cross-DTA/cross-discovery phase decision-making - Supporting research teams for timely and smooth asset transition from research to early development
Who you are You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. You have an advanced degree in science/life sciences with a depth know-how in the early R&D phases of drug discovery and a deep understanding of the lead identification, optimization and evaluation process of molecules in a multidisciplinary environment and matrix organizations. A MBA plus minimum 3-4 years of experience in consulting for/ in biotech, pharmaceuticals or a related field is a clear asset for this role. Your proven strategic agility and strong understanding of R&D trends, strategy and markets, and drug development will help you in being successful and easily up to speed. You bring an excellent communication , strategic and analytical thinking and a proven value as a thought partner to business leaders and project teams, specifically, framing and decision support for complex issues
Are you interested? We are looking a person who thinks beyond the job offered - someone who knows that this position can be a rare springboard to many other opportunities at Roche. Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building teams that represents a range of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.
If you still have questions then please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq. Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
Roche is an equal opportunity employer.
Research & Development, Research & Development > Portfolio Management

job.title: Commercial (H/F)
job.plaincontent:
Leader du marché Suisse, expert de l’éclairage et de la technologie LED, avec un siège à Bâle et près de 600 collaborateurs dans 7 pays, REGENT Appareils d’éclairage conseille les planificateurs-éclairagistes, les architectes, les installateurs ainsi que les clients finaux dans la mise en place de solutions d’éclairage innovantes.Pour notre filiale française, notamment la région Parisienne - Ile de France, nous recherchons un/une
Commercial (H/F)
Vos missions
- Rattaché au Directeur de notre filiale française, vous développez la prescription en approchant une clientèle constituée pour l’essentiel d’architectes, de bureaux d’études et de clients finaux. - Vous identifiez, prospectez et fidélisez l’ensemble des acteurs susceptibles d’être impliqués dans des projets d’éclairage. - Vous bénéficiez de l’appui de notre bureau d’études pour accompagner nos clients dans l’élaboration de leurs projets et pour monter les offres. - Nous vous apportons un soutien régulier en matière de communication et de valorisation de nos produits: réceptions, présentations en showroom, supports visuels, participation aux salons. - Vous travaillerez en Home office et/ou dans nos bureaux parisiens avec l’appui de notre équipe support.
Profil / Qualifications
- De formation commerciale, vous avez une expérience de 3 ans minimum dans la vente de produits de prescription, éclairage, second œuvre du bâtiment, mobilier de bureau, etc., en tant que commercial ou account manager. - Sensible à l’esthétique, vous alliez savoir-faire relationnel et commercial. - La bonne connaissance des architectes et/ou des circuits d’achats des enseignes constitue un plus.
Nous vous offrons
- Vous pourrez vous exprimer au sein de notre société riche d’une tradition centenaire qui se distingue par des voies décisionnelles courtes, une innovation constante, des processus efficaces et la valorisation du potentiel humain. - Salaire fixe + commissions
Nous vous remercions d’adresser votre dossier de candidature à:
Isabelle Teichmueller T+41 61 335 52 13Online bewerben

job.title: Technische/r Sachbearbeiter/in Verkauf Innendienst
job.plaincontent:
Wir sind ein europaweit agierendes Unternehmen, das hochwertige Leuchten und Lichtsysteme anbietet. Unsere Produkte werden in der Schweiz bei unserer Muttergesellschaft entwickelt und hergestellt.Für unsere Niederlassung in Deutschland mit Sitz in Düsseldorf suchen wir eine/n fachlich versierte/n
Technische/r Sachbearbeiter/in Verkauf Innendienst
Ihre Aufgaben
- Enge Zusammenarbeit und Koordination mit dem Aussendienst - Kalkulieren, Erstellen und Überwachen von Angeboten inkl. Nachverfolgung - Begleitende Überwachung der Auftragsausführung - Telefonische Betreuung unserer Kundschaft - Zusammenarbeit mit den Fachabteilungen im Mutterhaus
Ihr Profil
- Sie verfügen über eine elektrotechnische oder kaufmännische Ausbildung - Sie bringen mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in der Leuchten- und Lichtbranche mit - Sie besitzen gute Kenntnisse der MS-Office-Produkte - Sie sprechen und schreiben stilsicher in Deutsch (Englischkenntnisse von Vorteil) - Sie sind eine flexible, engagierte sowie ziel- und ergebnisorientierte Persönlichkeit mit ausgeprägtem Teamgeist
Wir bieten Ihnen

job.title: Lichtberater/in im Innendienst
job.plaincontent:
Regent Lighting mit Sitz in Basel beschäftigt rund 600 Mitarbeiter in sechs Ländern, ist Marktführer in der Schweiz und einer der führenden Leuchtenhersteller in Europa. Über Distributionspartner werden unsere Produkte international in 35 Ländern vertrieben.Unsere Abteilung Lichtplanung und Projektleitung der Filiale Zürich ist zuständig für die Umsetzung und Konzipierung der Grossprojekte im erweiterten Raum Zürich.
Unterstützen Sie uns dabei als
Lichtberater/in im Innendienst
Ihre Aufgaben
- Kontrolle, Bereinigung und Erfassung von Auftragsdaten im System - Aktives Telemarketing (systematisches Nachfassen von Offerten) - Verantwortlich für das zeitgerechte Erstellen von Akonto- und Schlussrechnungen - Verantwortlich für die Auftragskoordination - Beratung und Betreuung der Kunden (Elektriker) - Koordination von Bestellungen - Kalkulation von Verkaufspreisen - Betreuung von mittelgrossen Projekten - Selbständiges Erarbeiten von Beleuchtungsberechnungen
Ihr Profil
- Sie haben eine kaufmännische oder elektrotechnische Ausbildung mit Erfolg abgeschlossen und sich idealerweise als Lichtplaner/in oder Lichtdesigner/in SLG weitergebildet - Sie bringen technisches Verständnis mit - Sie haben Erfahrung im Verkaufsinnendienst sowie in der Abwicklung von Projekten - Sie sind versiert im Umgang mit MS-Office-Anwendungen - Sie besitzen einwandfreie Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, Englischkenntnisse von Vorteil - Sie arbeiten selbständig, strukturiert und behalten stets den Überblick - Sie sind stets darauf bedacht optimale Lösungen für den Kunden und Regent zu erarbeiten - Sie sind eine kommunikative Person, welche gerne im Team arbeitet
Wir bieten Ihnen
- Ein innovatives Unternehmen in einem dynamischen Umfeld - Gelebte Tradition in Verbindung mit Werten wie Qualität und Wissen - Flexible Arbeitszeiten - Ein breites Angebot an Aus- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten in der Regent Lighting ACADEMY
Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung

job.title: Lastwagen-Mechaniker (m/w)
job.plaincontent:
MAN Truck & Bus Schweiz AG ist ein Unternehmen der global agierenden MAN Gruppe. Mit 800 Mitarbeitenden in 27 privaten und eigenen Niederlassungen sind wir ein führender Full Range Anbieter von Transportern, LKWs und Bussen sowie professioneller Dienstleister für den Nutzfahrzeugbereich in der ganzen Schweiz.
MAN bewegt den Fortschritt und setzt weltweit Massstäbe bei LKWs, Bussen, Trans- portern, Motoren und Dienstleistungen. Nutzen Sie Ihre Chance und profitieren Sie von einem dynamischen Umfeld, das Ihnen attraktive Perspektiven eröffnet. Für unseren Servicebetrieb am Standort Otelfingen/ZH suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung:
LASTWAGEN-MECHANIKER/IN
Ihre Aufgaben Aufgrund Umstrukturierung und Neuausrichtung des Servicebetriebes, wünschen wir uns eine flexible und aufgestellte Persönlichkeit, welche bereit ist, diesen «Start-Up» Spirit mit zu tragen. Wir wünschen uns eine teamfähige Persönlichkeit, welche mit Leidenschaft Service, Wartungs- und Instandsetzungsarbeiten, sowie gesetzliche Prüfungen an LKW, Linien- und Reisebussen, Transportern und Anhängern durch- führt. Ihnen ist bewusst, dass unsere Kunden an erster Stelle stehen und Sie sind zu Pannenhilfen, Aussenmontagen und Mitarbeit im 24h Notdienst bereit, gemäss unserem Motto „Zusammen bewegen wir mehr“.
Wir bieten Ihnen
- Eine 41 Stundenwoche und mindestens 25 Ferientage! - Weihnachten und Neujahr ist frei! - Volle Finanzierung des Führerausweises C! - Gratis Parkplatz! - 100% Lohnfortzahlung bei Krankheit / Unfall während 2 Jahren! - Tiefe Lohnabzüge = HÖHERES NETTOGEHALT! - Überdurchschnittliche Vorsorgelösung! MAN Truck & Bus Schweiz AG
Personalabteilung
Sie bieten uns Tannstrasse 1 Ihre Begeisterung, für ein Premium Produkt zu arbeiten Postfach Eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung als LKW.- Baumaschinen- oder Landmaschinen- CH - 8112 Otelfingen mechaniker
hr.mtb.schweiz@man.eu Sind Sie motiviert? Dann zögern Sie nicht und senden Sie uns Ihre Bewerbungsun- www.mantruckandbus.ch terlagen an die nebenstehende E-Mail- oder Postadresse.
Wir freuen uns, Sie schon bald persönlich kennenzulernen!

job.title: Bauingenieur/in als Projektleiter/in 100%
job.plaincontent:
Gestalten Sie Basel. Zu den Aufgaben des Tiefbauamts zählen die Projektierung, Realisierung und der Unterhalt der kantonalen Verkehrs- und Infrastrukturbauten. Infolge einer Vakanz suchen wir im Bereich Strassen und Kunstbauten eine/n engagierte/n
Bauingenieur/in als Projektleiter/in
100%
Ihre Aufgaben
In dieser Funktion sind Sie mitverantwortlich für die Gewährleistung der Betriebssicherheit der kantonseigenen Kunstbauten (Brücken, Tunnel, Stützmauern etc.). Sie führen Inspektionen der Bauwerke durch, dokumentieren diese, ordnen notwendige Massnahmen an und überprüfen die Einhaltung der Qualität und Normen. Kleinere Instandsetzungsarbeiten laufen unter Ihrer Federführung. Weiter erarbeiten Sie in einem Team von Projektleiter/innen Vorprojekte im Bereich Strassen und Kunstbauten.
Unsere Anforderungen
Sie verfügen über eine abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung im Tiefbau (Bauingenieur/in FH oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung) und haben mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Erhaltung, Planung und Projektierung von Strassen- und Kunstbauten. Sie haben ein sicheres und korrektes Auftreten und vertreten unsere Interessen gleichermassen bei Unternehmungen, Werken und der Bevölkerung. Sie haben eine gute schriftliche Ausdrucksweise und beherrschen die Informatikanwendungen von MS-Office und GIS bestens. Wenn Sie zudem selbständig, termingerecht und zuverlässig arbeiten, sind Sie bei uns an der richtigen Stelle.
Unser Angebot
Wir bieten Ihnen ein spannendes Tätigkeitsgebiet bei zeitgemässen Anstellungsbedingungen in einem vielseitigen Team.
Kontakt
Weitere Auskünfte erteilt Ihnen gerne Michael Schweizer, Leiter Strassen Kunstbauten Leitungstunnel (SKL), Tel. 061 267 93 00.
Bewerbung
Wir freuen uns auf Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen.elektronischOnline-Bewerben
per PostKanton Basel-Stadt: Bau- und Verkehrsdepartement Human Resources Münsterplatz 11 CH-4001 BaselWeiterempfehlung Drucken Mitarbeiten und mitgestalten.www.stellen.bs.ch

job.title: Fachperson Logopädie 80%
job.plaincontent:
Logopädie ist ein Förderangebot für Schülerinnen und Schüler mit Auffälligkeiten im Bereich der Sprache, des Sprechens, des Redeflusses, der Stimme, der Kommunikationsfähigkeit und des Schluckens. Auch das Lesen, Schreiben oder das Zahlenverständnis gehören zu den Entwicklungsbereichen. Für die Privatschulen suchen wir auf den 1. August 2020 eine
Fachperson Logopädie
80%
Ihre Aufgaben
Als Fachperson Logopädie an den Privatschulen führen Sie logopädische Abklärungen durch, Therapien im Einzel- oder Kleingruppensetting und logopädische integrierte Sprachförderung in Kleingruppen oder im Klassenverband. Sie bieten logopädische Fachberatung für die Lehr- und Fachpersonen, Schulleitungen und Erziehungsberechtigten an sowie logopädische Präventionsmassnahmen im Regelunterricht.
Unsere Anforderungen
Sie verfügen über ein EDK-anerkanntes Logopädie-Diplom, sind bereit integrativ und an verschiedenen Standorten zu arbeiten. Sie sind flexibel, teamfähig, kooperativ, strukturiert und kennen das Basler Schulsystem.
Unser Angebot
Wir bieten Ihnen eine abwechslungsreiche und herausfordernde Aufgabe in einem lebendigen Team bei fairen und fortschrittlichen Anstellungsbedingungen.
Kontakt
Für weitere Auskünfte steht Ihnen gerne die Leiterin der Fachstelle Förderung und Integration, Soshya Kaufmann Crain, Telefon +41 (0)61 267 84 77 oder per Mail soshya.kaufmann@bs.ch zur Verfügung.
Bewerbung
Wir freuen uns auf Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen.elektronischOnline-Bewerben
per PostFachstelle Förderung und Integration Soshya Kaufmann Crain Rosentalstrasse 17 CH-4058 BaselWeiterempfehlung Drucken Basel-Stadt beschäftigt.www.stellen.bs.ch
